5U8Yas1_-rCpU6dVLQPSaw.text: Great little restaurant/brewery. Food is good, beers are excellent and the patio is amazing. One of my favorite places in this city!

7-DxnbLoe_8SU19EBRCKFw.text: A friend and I were visiting from out of town and our Uber  suggested we try it out. We got drinks at the bar after we got on the waitlist for a table. It was Saturday night and they were super busy but had plenty of seating and we found a spot at one of the many community tables they have in their out door patio. Great vibes all around. Burgers were fine, beers were fine. We really enjoyed the atmosphere.

9Sout7Bxp8r8ozm89q2sfQ.text: If we could give half stars I'd give this place a 3.5. I was tremendously disappointed in the pretzels. The cheese dip they came with was cold. I guess it was supposed to come this way but to me and my 2 guests it was not good at all. I've honestly never had cold cheese dip with pretzels or anything else for that matter. I would say they saved themselves with the pimento cheese dip. That was amazing. The beer selection was also great. Service was good as well. I would definitely recommend this place, just not the pretzels.

JRiiDv6v38g_XOUNmfns-Q.text: Got the chicken-n-biscuit and it definitely did not disappoint! Such a cool, Instagram-worthy spot as well.

7r-zDtU_tUGwx-LaVLfOHQ.text: Came to this place with high hopes! Bartender was nice but the cocktail list was 13$ so friend and I decided to do simple vodka sodas. Turns out that was the WRONG idea because APPARENTLY a house vodka soda is the same price as any of the cocktails which is 13$. Very disappointed that I was not informed of this. Any bar I've ever been to the house cocktail is cheaper than the specialty drinks. I would've much rather had a specialty drink for 13$ than a house drink for the same price. Would've loved to be informed about the prices.

r62Kv5WSk83i8yO_ypDOow.text: Extremely POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE and parking is horrible.  I attempted to have a brunch outing here in which reservations were made at least a week in advance.  We all showed up on time and the hostess confirmed the reservation (even placing a reservation tag with the organizers name on it), within 15 minutes of the hostess setting up the table the manager, Patrick walks up to our party to tell us the reservation was cancelled and there was nothing they could do to seat us together.  He mentioned that another party will be seated in the section we reserved and that we would have to wait an additional hour.  Patrick did nothing to try to remedy the situation. ysXtu2alGfEBdQemQCvM0w.text: Sat out on the patio with some friends on a Saturday morning. Busy but not too crowded when we ordered coffees and brunch at the bar. Generally good atmosphere. Latte was cold when it came out which wasn't the best but not a big deal. But, I was the first to order and my food just never really came. The rest of my party had all eaten (one other person's order was wrong and asked the waitress to bring her the sausage she paid for and they never brought this out either after she asked). I spoke to the woman bringing out food and she knew I was missing my food, she just seemed to not get them to put me at the front of the line. I probably watched about 20 chicken biscuits come out as I waited. Eventually she just had my food come out to go, so I ate my now cold $14 chicken biscuit at home.

From the food to the excellent beer/cocktail selection to the vibrant atmosphere, this is a can't miss. Check it out, definitely won't be disappointed!

FAdEqSPuzmx1rwnA2z39-A.text: Beautiful decor and the food was pretty good when they opened, but with over-priced drinks, no parking and now what seemed to be mediocre food, I don't know that I'll be back.  I should have put in my 4+ star review when I first went in early August, but I guess I never got around to it.  I like the Hyde beers, so, I'm hoping other places start to carry them as well.  There is a lack of good food at our breweries in NC, I assume due to some weird ABC law.  Upon my first visit, I thought all that had changed.  2nd visit with just went with some burgers and pickles.  They weren't bad really, but no clue why they are charging so much.  I don't know.  Maybe it was just an off night.  I wish I could tell you more, but it just doesn't seem to live up the hype.

NntHv7R47zYsZU7l421sFQ.text: First impression of this place: WOAH what a gorgeous space! Industrial chic if that's a thing? Levers, pipes, exposed brick, reclaimed wood, hanging plants from the ceiling, and big windows! The restaurant area is one big room with a ton of natural light a relaxed feel, and a ton of seating at booth, table or, bar. There's also a whole patio area that I didn't get to explore, but it looked large as well.   Pro-tip: seating at the bar is first-come first-serve, so if there's a wait, stalk the bar. Works for me and my boo all the time.   We tried the Grouper Ceviche first which was great quality fish and a good sized portion, but the dish was a little plain for me as far as the flavor. Next, we had the Charred Shishito Peppers, which was really flavorful and yummy! Plenty to split between two people. My favorite was the Potato Croquettes which were fried, cheesy, and had an awesome tomato based sauce. All of this shared between two people plus a beer was actually enough to fill me up! If you are super hungry though, you might need a bit more.  Service was decent considering it was their second day open, but they are still working out a few kinks. One major plus is that all register's talk to each other, meaning if you start a tab inside, but then move outside, you can still add more to your tab from anywhere.

_dEZ2-xC4AN9k6bvZIo4gA.text: This place never disappoints!! I have always come here for the rose and brunch but today I branched our and tried a cocktail. I typically get Hendricks and tonic but the bartender said the only have a local gin called cardinal. I probably looked very skeptical because she said don't worry it's really good. I took a chance and wasn't disappointed! Suffolk Punch seems like a place where the staff really cares about the patrons and the food/beverages they serve. If It gets really crowded check out the warehouse behind the outdoor bar- it's a cool place to escape the heat or host an event.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

j7XT8w38bzKZ3AgYoryDLg.text: Okay - huge disclaimer. We visited during the 2nd day of their soft opening, so they have a bit of growing pains to get over. That being said, I'm really excited for where Suffolk Punch is going to go.  The Lady and I went around 7:45ish and parking was a little tight, but we were able to find a spot in the side lot at the very back. We walked in from the door that's on the street...which is apparently not the front door. Weird. Would like to have seen signage for that. We walked down the hallway to the big expanse that is the main room. It's a gorgeous, open space with plenty of greenery hanging from the rafters, and a wrapping outdoor patio that's pretty incredible as well.  We found the hostess (again, at the complete opposite side of the building than we walked in from) and she told us it was going to be about a 30-45 minute wait. Woah. So we found 2 seats at the bar by the "coffee cage". It definitely did take some time for somebody to notice us, and there were no drink menus to be found (we had to ask for them twice during the duration of our stay) which was a bit of a frustration, but it didn't bring me down too much. We both ordered beers (Pro Tip: Order by #, it'll make the waiters lives a lot easier!), and then we went on to food. Everything came out fast, which was a giant plus! We got:  Grouper Ceviche: Light, citrisy, a bit spicy, and a great texture. I missed the aromatics, but enjoyed the radish. Might've been nice for a bit more crunch in there, but very good nonetheless. Charred Shishito Peppers: One of my favorite snacks. There's no way you can mess these up. Killed em in a matter of minutes. Potato Croquettes: Excellent! Dense, moist, flavorful, and fried. Perfect combo. Loved the tomato and gruyere was a *perfect* cheese choice! Charcuterie Plate: Big hits and a few qualms. 1) There was only 1 cheese on the board. Granted, one was peppered and one wasn't, but it wasn't very balanced. 2) Meats were cut at very different sizes. 3) Picked onions were sweet and delicious, whole grain mustard felt like it was kicked up with horseradish or wasabi, but both excellent. 4) I learned that duck pate is not my thing. And that's okay. I think it was done very well, but the taste is a bit more refined from what I was in the mood for. It was also strange that the duck fat was hard and on top. Didn't know if I was supposed to eat that or not...  Prices were totally acceptable for the portions that we got (2 drinks and 4 menu items totaled out to just under $50, and we walked away pleasantly full).   They need to get their roastery started up, as well as release their own beers, and do more with food fermentation. But, in any case, I'm actually really looking forward to seeing Suffolk Punch flourish. They got a good thing going. If nothing else, their 6:30am open time will be *perfect* for early morning coffee sessions :)

WcA0hDgP9qmFzl399YgAuQ.text: Their food is awesome but a little bit pricey. We have been here several times and the service is hit or miss. We have had great people and then also someone who didn't come check on us for an hour and was rude after. Definitely still a favorite spot.

LsXmasmrQh3ZZrTEqTNrSw.text: Good drinks but the bar service sucks. The girl bartenders have RBF and only serve certain people. They overlook half the bar and will serve the people they know over and over before they serve you one time.

ClDE-oZMNhNS66MONq2D7Q.text: I've had brunch here a few times on Sunday's with the boys for game day. Overall, not a bad place to grab a few craft beers. They have a lot of specials on their beers, usually 3 bucks for a pint so that's a plus. The food isn't bad, I've had better, but overall decent and a good portion. They have a tent with a heater over their outdoor patio in the colder months so they always have space. The prices are about right for the location. It's in walking distance from me so I'll probably go back frequently.

Y0uLA6Sx1HPZnIT5f0zlgg.text: The atmosphere is great! I love the decorations. Overall, it's a very aesthetically pleasing place.  The food was also tasty.... HOWEVER... my friend and I had 1 drink and 2 small plates (nachos and chicken wings) and our bill was $41. That's a little ridiculous.  I think the most disappointing part was the staff. We walked to the hostess stand where 3 girls were standing. None acknowledged us. Finally, my friend asked a short haired, blonde girl if it was seat yourself (more as a "why haven't you acknowledged us?"). She seemed extremely confused.   After we were sat, it took a bit for someone to come to our table. When she did, she immediately told us that she wasn't sure if we were her table or not and if we weren't, someone different would be coming over. Ok?   I ordered a cocktail and she told me that because my cocktail didn't fall in line with what was on the cocktail menu, and it was "that time of the day" (aka 4pm on a Saturday), she didn't think the bartender could accommodate my request. It literally was the difference of grabbing one type of vodka vs. another. The even stranger thing was that there was a note on the menu stating that other cocktails besides what was listed on the cocktail menu could be made.   After all that, my drink was not good, at all.  When we ordered, it was clear that the waitress didn't know the menu. We asked for the nachos to come without onions and she responded that she wasn't sure if it came with onions and grabbed one our menus to check.

97o9TE99L9kQmtrdYiWxew.text: You can't go wrong with any of their beers (also hello $3 Thursday local beer special), cocktails, or pretty much any drink.  I once had a burger here and it was OK, but recently visited and had the Reuben and YOU.MUST.GET. Literally the most mouth watering Reuben I've had in Charlotte yet. Will visit time and time again

1yPNz9xaIBJ5NPQNHmYvTA.text: I would be more satisfied with a Wendy's dave burger. This burger had a weird taste. It tasted like the meat was boiled then grilled. Little salt, little pepper... no taste at all. Beer was good. The staff was great.

SPMppp3UV_3o7wpdj5Gt2A.text: My first experience wasn't so great because their was some issues with reservation but We made our way back for our 2nd experience and it was great. The food, drinks were great and service. They kept their promise and took care of us. They even have a new system set up for text confirmation to verify reservation. I appreciate Seth the owner for understanding our frustration the first time around and making our second experience better. Management tonight took care of us even though our whole party wasn't there. I can see myself going back and I would recommend this place to others.

hSqYycbBO_blqgJ6W4oZCA.text: I've been here a few times for beer and coffee, but this was my first visit for the food and it pretty good! I love the space and the decor. It reminds me of being in NYC; definitely a lot different than most restaurants here!   We started with housemade pimento cheese, it has bacon jam on it and was pretty good. The bacon jam added more flavor to it. We also got the Suffolk Punch Burger-tasty, but be warned the bun is an English muffin so it did fall apart some while eating. (Forgot a picture!)  Six hour pork belly- a friend ordered this and said it was good, but I didn't try it so you'll have to see for yourself! NC Bison Short rib- perfectly cooked, fell off the bone and was so tender. It sat on top of polenta and had a nice glaze to it.   We'll definitely be back whether it's to watch some games or enjoy a cup of coffee or beer. I'll have to try out more of the menu next time!

nnxpWXGezXUwSYoEP_515g.text: Great food and great atmosphere! The menu is very allergen friendly. Everything is clearly marked and the staff are very knowledgeable. I will definitely be back!

IPQzJ225mJQ8V3j7ms1l1g.text: The great thing about The Suffolk Punch?  It's a coffeeshop: Offering Hyde Coffee on tap as early as 07:30am on weekdays (09:00am on weekends), as well as fresh and local Whisk & Wood pastries. Lucky you, morning commuters, on South End Rail Trail, this is your grab-and-go coffee spot from the walk-up patio coffee bar.  Loved the Nitro Coffee on-draft.   It's a taphouse: Offering rotating seasonal menu, staring at 11:30am everyday, with soy-, dairy- and gluten-free options. Weekend brunch is every Sat/Sun 10:00am - 03:00pm. Loved the meltingly tender NC Bison Short Rib.  It's a brewery: Offering 48 local taps (Hyde beers & local ones), wine, and cocktails. Try the Midlenhall Treasure cocktail if you know what's goof for you.   It's a Fermentation lab: Focusing on zymology- fermentation process used in beer.  I'm totally in love with the hip, yet inviting industrial dining room, and the forest vibe.   Four Solid Yelps.

97RSKY2MZHvc9gUFZTPTdQ.text: Being new to the area a co-worker brought me here and I loved it for the atmosphere the outside tent, the fantastic bar and great bartenders who make some very delicious drinks.  I love that you walk past the stills to get to the bar in the back which is unusual and the outside patio is the perfect "downtown" feeling spot especially when the train rolls though.    I like most of their own beers and the flights while restricted to their brand (understandable) they are well worth the try.

FUjiNo9EMCH6X3Y4fLg_iQ.text: Loved the vibe of this place, right when I walked in, it had hipster written all over it!  I was in Charlotte for a work trip so I easily snagged a spot at the bar.  The place was packed on a Saturday night, they had this great covered outdoor patio area with a bar outside.  Looked like a great place to hang out.  First off, I get it, it's busy on a Saturday night and I am by myself but it took a very long time to get service.  Definitely why I knocked down this place a star.  I decided to order the carchuittere plate and the fried green tomatoes.  I also had to get a beer, I got the local brewed one and loved it!  The carchurittere plate was very nice, I did wish it had one more soft cheese to it but the meat selection was great.  I am a sucker for fried green tomatoes and this one had a cornmeal crust to it so it was thick and hot off the fryer when I had it.  With the sauce it was a great little dish.    Definitely this place is a great place to hang out with a group of friends and grab some beers but also a good dinner spot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner menu

lRunH-N-EAmqxN4MlOv0bA.text: I heard really good things about this place after it opened, so I scheduled a happy hour here.   Walking in, I immediately loved the decor. All of the plants are my favorite part. It was nice out so we sat on the patio.   They have a really large drink selection from their own beers, to other craft beer, to ciders, to cocktails. I had a cocktail and some ciders and they were all really good.   I ordered some small plates: the Pimiento cheese, the beet stained deviled eggs, and the tuna crudo. I enjoyed all of them, but they were a little expensive for the portion sizes you got.   My experience was pretty good until it started to get dark and cold outside and we tried to go inside. They wouldn't let us sit inside unless we ordered an entree. Given that we had already eaten and were trying to enjoy the brewery, this was very frustrating. I get that it's also a restaurant, but the fact that there is no way to enjoy the brewery without being outside is ridiculous.   We convinced someone to order an entree and the service inside want very good. The burger want cooked as ordered and the service was slow. The food is also pretty expensive.   I've avoided going here for happy hours since then because I don't want to be forced to sit outside if I don't want to eat. I think this is a pretty big problem they need to solve if they don't want to be a restaurant exclusively.

DQTUamoY53h0UV7oy6gU6w.text: Conflicted on this one...  It's raining ... it's pouring ... it's 5 PM Friday  Whew! Found a parking spot no problem.  Although the interior space seems a bit condensed the decor is beautiful and has a nice warm feeling.  The restaurant was probably 70% empty. My nine year old Foodie in training and I were ready to strap on the old feed bag, being super excited about the multifaceted concept here. The hostesses hesitated, talked amongst themselves and finally seated us at the end of a long high top that had another party already seated at it. It was kind of weird and uncomfortable when there were so many booths and tables empty and two of the occupied ones had two people only (were we being isolated/concentrated/ were we not worth a booth or proper table); even my kid picked up on it.  I ordered a Latte and soon found out the coffee bar was closed minutes before. I had no idea coffee service ended and swore there was a statement on the menu that referred to all selections being available until 6PM ( I could be wrong though). I said I would settle for just a plain old house cup of coffee. Nope. Surely I thought someone could make a cup of coffee (there were quite a few employees hanging around the inside of the kitchen doors eating and laughing). No biggie I thought, probably a shift change but this would have been an opportunity for someone to step up and provide stellar, gee it's only 10 past anyway, service. As a side note, for me, part of a fine dining experience (and the food here is excellent by the way) is having dessert and good coffee at the end; I personally don't want dessert without coffee. They have the high quality dessert (even though I was told they were out of Bananas Foster) and they have the high quality coffee but it's just not available together. Alright, so now that I've gone on and on with my old man diatribe/rant about no coffee, let's talk about the food.  The menu is chock full of some really nice selections - we ordered the small plates of Argentine Steak and The PEI Mussels. Both of them were artistically presented dishes. The rough chop chimichurri was good - the steak was nicely cooked and the blistered peppers were cooked perfectly. The broth on the mussels with the sun dried tomatoes and sliced fennel were a delicious combination I'd not had before. I just wish there had been more of them - there was however plenty of grilled bread for dipping.  So a mixed experience - the food = wonderful - but some of the weirdness I experienced dulled it a bit (I didn't even get to use my Yelp check in offer). Oh, and the beer they make is pretty dang tasty, especially their NE Style IPAs!

lL_uWiWUp6biXiqF3_kt3A.text: I've been here for brunch on sundays and for late night beer a few different times. Let's start with late night .. Beer is tasty. They have a huge variety. But they're also often out of a lot of options. It's a fun spot to go at night but they stop serving food kinda early and can sometimes be overcrowded.  Brunch is good, definitely more relaxed! Service is a little slow and it's definitely a little pricey for what you get. Eating outside is nice & the atmosphere is really awesome. It's just not somewhere I need to go every week.. or every month.

VhfCZ8MlIIGeUgyazCGxFw.text: Pros: good food, cute decor, large outdoor space, close to the light rail Cons: very limited parking, overpriced  My friend and I went for brunch this morning. It's somewhat confusing when you walk in... it's a brewery, restaurant and coffee shop all in one. The hostess seemed pretty clueless... we asked for a booth for 2. There was an empty booth right behind us, but it took several minutes for them to seat us at that booth (which was already clean and available when we walked in the door). But it's all good. The food and drinks were overpriced, but very good. We split cornbread muffins, and I had 2 mimosas and shrimp and grits. My check was $35. The service was decent. The decor is very cozy and eclectic, and we enjoyed our meal.   I'll be back, but I don't imagine I'll be a regular.

9U7F7om-iXUo0MMqASWbCA.text: I was really disappointed after being so excited to try this place out. I took time on a Sunday to come all the way out there just to get rude service. The girl working the cashier was extremely rude and had such an attitude. Being our first time she was very unhelpful. I told her it was our first time and to inform us of the flavors of coffee and she didn't really seem interested in helping further or giving suggestions. Any question I asked she acted like I was stupid and would look away after like I was wasting her time. Ordering took longer than it needed to because of this and she did not inform us they only had one size of ice coffee until after she poured it. She broke off in the middle of our order to fill one of our coffees with such an attitude we just looked at each other and contemplated leaving right then. Finally I told her I would try the lavender latte but we were so irritated at that point that we didn't order any of the other things we wanted to try and left.  We will unfortunately not be back.

idyANHYDAv8jBXrN1ic7Kg.text: So upset I swear. So I had this place bookmarked on my yelp for a little while only to be disappointed when I finally came. So last week I came here on a Sunday to watch the game . When I pulled it up on yelp I seen it was a wait so I put myself on the wait list so by the time I arrived I could be seated . When I arrived I let the moody hostess know that I was on the waiting list so I showed her she said they would call my name when ready. Well after standing up for awhile I finally asked is it a wait to sit outside too or is it a separate wait list low n behold she was like oh no it's no wait list u can just go out there . Omg I swear if she would have just told me that from the beginning would have made things much easier ! So I'm sitting outside waiting for a waiter or waiter or waitress to come and assist me and when I noticed no one was coming to take my order I stopped one of the waiters and asked , so is anyone gonna take my order ?? He then proceeds to tell me oh u have to go to the tower and place the order yourself . Well thanks being that I never been here before I was not aware of that . The menu was all over the place so I just kept it simple n ordered a chicken biscuit . They gave me a number and someone shortly after brought it out and may I add this was the biggest chicken biscuit I had seen. While I'm sitting there figuring out how I'm going to eat this biscuit without making a huge mess I notice well I don't have any napkins.? Come to find out I had to go get those myself too. Nobody brought me any silverware or anything. Next thing you know these two guys with these two huge dogs came and set next to me on the bench's well I am terrified of dogs so that all in all made me uncomfortable. I guess this is a good spot for people that have dogs and want to go eat and enjoy while they bring their pets along but everyone is not fond of that so they should keep that in mind .Maybe have a separate section for the dogs perhaps?  I finally got fed up with having to keep stopping a waiter or waitress to ask about silverware napkins etc so I finally just asked can I have a to go box and i packed my biscuit up and I was out of there like Mario Andretti . I ended up throwing the biscuit away when I got home it wasn't even fit to eat because it fell over in the box and the sauce was all over everything . I will never step foot back in here if my life depended on it and the staff is not the nicest on top of it all !

vFgXLTk2iiuwslENf-m5RA.text: I enjoy their beer/cocktail/coffee situation.  All of the food I have had there for brunch and lunch has been fantastic.  I did note that the menu items were quite pricey.  Hubs rode the Lynx down to meet me for lunch and we were surprised their lunch menu was so expensive.  I would think they'd want to attract a decent lunch crowd, but not worth the train ride (or drive) from Uptown.  Great outdoor space.  I'll be back, but not as often as I'd like.

0q0g3jvb7kYeM6iUkO613Q.text: I love bars that have a personality to them and that is definitely Suffolk Punch. It's a massive outdoor/indoor space with cool grass accents. The place has an extensive beer menu, a different menu, and coffee bar. I went for their nachos which came with a cool cheese crema instead of melted cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

e49j8F0-sO_wgLafredQ4w.text: We have visited Suffolk Punch on a few occasions and I just think it is a-okay. I really think it hovers over 4 stars merely due to atmosphere but here is why it is a solid-3.  1. The outdoor area and indoor area is phenomenal. From the cozy booth seating to the warm communal tables, both exude True "coolness." If you want to watch a game, great. If you want to have good conversation you're able to do so.  2.  Lots of great beer options if you're into that thing. But I can't drink it. And you only offer one, very mediocre, blanco tequila for me to drink. like, WOOF. You pride yourself on such quality beers AND a great menu, but ave a SOLID full bar, too. who is behind your cocktail menu? I opt for wine, which is also sub-par offerings. Just disappointing.  3. The food is inventive with amazing flavors. I really appreciate the gluten-friendly menu. I wish the cheese board was larger, and we'd be happy to pay more. For brunch, however, don't tell me that i can't get egg whites. If you have real eggs, you have egg whites. Any line-cook should be able to separate the yolk from the egg in about two seconds. The hash was AMAZING but I don't like egg yolks. J had the chicken and biscuit and it looked amazing. Bacon was great, too!  Haven't totally written this place off, but we don't always go out of our way to get here. Does get pretty packed on the weekends so arrive early and grab a spot.

4QO26YXuszz3vCi5IssQuQ.text: I had a work event at Suffolk Punch, and we had reserved an outdoor space in advance for ~50 of us. The outdoor area is nice and clean. It is a great space for a big group, and affords ample room for mixing and mingling.   The food and drinks were great. What was disappointing was the server situation - our huge group had 1 server. You can imagine how insufficient that was for our group of 50+. I was there for over 2 hours and only got 1 drink the entire time. I tried hunting down the server multiple times to no avail.   Further, our food was set out when we arrived, but we ran out of plates, cups for water, napkins, and water. There was no server to be found to replenish our depleted items. We went inside to request additional waitstaff to assist us, more water, plates, etc. and the indoor staff were not helpful and said our server would be out soon.   When you have a big group coming, and you know this, you need to have ample waitstaff for the group. I would try this place again with a small group, but I am not interested in attending future group events here unless they remedy the server situation.

sm33q1tvTGaOd4PbKObjpQ.text: incredible, everything was excellent. pleasant experience sitting outside and enjoyed a delicious sunday brunch.

pwzpalSeIrMx0x-iHYo9qg.text: I want to like this place. I really do. The decor is awesome. That's about it. Our waiter Tyler was inept to be nice. He forgot orders, forgot to bring us drinks, napkins, barely came by to even check on us. We ordered a variety of items, the foie gras popcorn was just very salty popcorn. The beet salad and the hamachi crudo were good. The bacon and tortillas were terrible, the bacon was rubbery, the fat was unrendered and gross. My wife got the burger with truffles. $30 for a burger that was not cooked to the temp that we wanted and included flavorless truffles and a very minor amount of them.  I did like the lime and the coconut drink though, 4-5 of them in it felt like I was at the beach! I'd recommend for drinks but def avoid for food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Grilled bacon&#34; aka grilled rubber. Sooo much unrendered fat we couldn&#39;t even cut through it.
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Medium well burger? Barely medium rare. Oh this pic doesn&#39;t include the $15 we paid for 3 tiny flavorless slices of black truffle.

NXo_6e7EASiMkK0Gvx33og.text: I'd give this place a one star for ambience and perhaps one and a half for food. We went there for Sunday brunch and the place was packed. Hostess said it would be about a 30 minute wait. We went to the bar which was standing room only. Female bartender that came over to us was very rude. We were seated in about 25 minutes in a booth. I ordered the French toast and unfortunately the pecan crust on it was burnt so it ruined the taste of the entire dish. My husband got a breakfast sandwich and stated it was delicious.  He ordered a second beer which our server forgot. All in all I more than likely would not return.

dcbtUNlC5ldp2wS-thXOZQ.text: Fresh local ingredients. I have been wanting to try this place for a while. I finally was in Charlotte for work and was able to go here. I tried the grass fed beef burger, the simple salad with citrus dressing and the morroccan spiced short ribs. Everything was amazing. Very fresh and great flavors. Yum!

8pANGPAn46zjAz7ZBmPw3Q.text: This is the first time I've been here, and everyone was great when I had a question. It sucks that some of my friends missed the cut off for food past what I was told, but I've worked in a kitchen before so I get it if you're off. I'm looking forward to coming back!

TEYhbvQB8a69XQbq7V4-Rg.text: I really wanted to love this place but unfortunately I was underwhelmed. My husband wanted to taste two different beers to see which one to order - they do not do tasting portions (weird for a brewery!). We have ordered three different small plates to share - everything was ok. I can't imagine wanting anything again enough to go back.  Sad because I had such expectations

h8vYvEUibY07B2DIaMu00g.text: Decided to stop in here for lunch on President's Day with my husband and co-workers. We ended up staying for two hours because we were having such a nice time. The service was great, efficient and checked in with us just enough, refilled waters without asking and was friendly but not annoying. We ordered a bunch of small plates to share with the table(I'm a sucker for small plates). We got the chorizo croquettes, the pimento cheese, the nachos with steak, pretzels with cheese dip, and the prosciutto platter. Everything was really tasty, but the standouts we're the onion jam and tomato jam on the prosciutto platter and the pimento cheese. So freaking good. Someone else at our table got the blt and it was the best blt she had ever tasted. So, while the food was great, the beer was amazing as well. They are doing really interesting things like using lavender in their saison, and rosemary in their Porter. So delicious. We liked it so much I took my brother in law and sister here two days later for coffee and drinks (did I mention they have a full coffee bar, and it's great too). I guess my only advice is to come here in the afternoon or on a day off when it isn't so busy and you'll have the best experience instead of a crowded Saturday night.

Ve4V6oXrjChmwx5JOl3T1g.text: I have been wanting to here since they opened. It was good. A wide array of beers on draft. The food was ok, creole shrimp just average. What purpose did the homey serve in the dish? None. The Moroccan rub ribs were better . Both dishes needed seasoning . Put some salt in the dishes.

bvumjCTUj0v3E4R6v8iuvA.text: Thought it might have been an off day for the service but judging by the reviews it seems like it's a common theme... the Hyde beer was good but the service was not pleasant.  When we went up to the outside bar the bartenders barely acknowledged and didn't seem to interested or enthused to help. The atmosphere is great, the food was decent and overall this place has potential.  I also think the Suffolk Punch/Hyde branding is a little confusing, wish they would just combine them into 1 but maybe that's just me. Will come back again because of the great location and atmosphere, hopefully will be able to update the review if the service is better!

jH-vTkYWaggwSXsfXyp03Q.text: My personal experience was an afternoon coffee. I gave the barista freedom to create and he did not disappoint! Most amazing oat milk spiced latte I have EVER had! Finished with nitro coffee to go and can't wIt for the next visit :)

Wn47gnizsMuK3moiLKv_hg.text: This is a very nice brewery, I love the decor and the ambience, definitely a nice spot to hang out.  Food is farm to table so not many colorful options if you will, limited choices honestly. I got the burger because it was the most appealing thing on the menu, but it was underwhelming. No condiments are on the burger, and it had sour pickles and carrots of all things as garnishes. Even with ketchup there was not much flavor. The French fries were amazing! The drinks were decent, no frozen options, but I enjoyed the cocktails I tasted. I was not very impressed by the service, in fact I watched our bartender ask me and my two friends if we wanted to leave our tabs open (we all said yes), and then proceed to close each of them out as if she didn't know what an open tab meant. I'm not sure if she didn't feel we were good for the money or what, but she knew what she was doing, because the man who ordered a drink and food after us also indicated he wanted his tab open and I watched her put his card in the card box. Hmmm... I didn't appreciate that, actually it was offensive.   Patio is dog friendly and there are nice shades to keep the sun off. Oh and fresh mint in the potted plants! I may give it another try in hopes of better treatment by the staff.

-35kMdbk4FQ1UO0mJA6ufQ.text: I went to try out their coffee, pretty neat and different. Didn't eat any food so not sure how I would rate it. I did try some of their beers. They have 5 of their own. They are ok, nothing too special. The staff was friendly. Looks like they will be brewing in house and not distributing. Reminds me of Heist.

9QB5EIPdPc92I9bI2ak3mg.text: Had an amazing time here for dinner last Thursday night. Our waiter was Tyler (aka "Iowa" or "Coach") and knew the menu well and was very helpful during our experience. The menu is def better than the typical brewery menu

CmuV0zLmbzNhFqRlWDjS0g.text: This is the first time we've been here for dinner, and we really enjoyed our time here! While we came by for coffee one morning, that previous experience was topped quickly by our dinner tonight because our server was Tyler. He was so friendly, helpful and accommodating to my husband's random requests. He made our experience great!

ixS3U7W4MltHw5RNYPIwUg.text: Great addition to the breweries that have popped up all over south end. Definitely did this place different from the rest and in a nice upgraded way. Everything from the tables to backsplash are all high end. Right off the light rail stop and free bike rental next to it.

UVHGbSOClGjoHkMts4TuEw.text: I think the concept is great but one thing that really threw me off was the music playing outside! I know that seems petty but music can totally throw off the vibe of a place. There was oldies and old R&B music playing both times we went! I think they could also use some yard games to liven up the outdoor area.

NZJO5AHGHzpxX01JjsmDUw.text: Really wanted to try it but 5:15 on a Thursday couldn't find parking spot. Some gobber was taking 2 spots in your parking lot.

wKQDTjwGjmzXe4HL9M35vA.text: There was a bit of a wait on a Friday night which is to be expected, but once we sat down and tried the first bite of food, we were pleasantly surprised by how fresh and tasty everything was. Their entrees were a little on the smaller side, but that might be because we loved the food so much and we wanted more. We haven't tried all their different drink conceptions but we're excited to try those out. Will be back soon!

XT5yHRZJI4fZbI4TlQ2qag.text: Great location, atmosphere and beer. Bar staff outside were super friendly, but my husband and I weren't greeted or acknowledged by staff inside. A simple hello or be right with you goes a long way.

p8N0Mww8ktCA8v3STYKzBw.text: The hand crafted cocktails are on point  Mike knows what he's doing. Definitely one of my top places to go in charlotte. Seasonal menu as well so you can mix it up.

K32FYVhrU4GFGrtqAofjqQ.text: I went here on the second weekend it was open. I was just there for drinks, but I didn't notice any growing pains. The atmosphere here is amazing!! The inside is decorated so well and it has a beautiful outside area. They have a good selection of unique beers, but prices are slightly above the average beer in the area. I'm excited to taste some of their own beers once they are released.

_V8gvyzEfCAI7Jk17C3oLg.text: Finally made an overdue visit to The Suffolk Punch for lunch. I had the cross-cut Moroccan ribs for a starter and the Shaved Wagyu Beef sandwich with fries.  The ribs were delicious, with a wonderful African/Middle Eastern spice on top of smoky meat. The portion was plenty for 2 people to split - actually quite surprising for $10.  The sandwich was on point! Tender beef, thinly sliced/shaved with crispy onion strings and horseradish on a Kimmelweck bun with a cup of au jus to dip. The au jus could've used a little more seasoning (mainly salt), but nonetheless, the sandwich as a whole was wonderful. The French fries were noticeably fresh cut and perfectly seasoned. Probably some of the best fries I've had in Charlotte.  I'm curious about the English Muffin Burger, so I'll be back for sure! They also have a coffee shop, and this place is part of Hyde Brewery, though I didn't try the coffee or beer.

2ZXi--8p1xEkZvbZNqNuaw.text: I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of this place for months.  The decor is great, their beers were solid, good selection of other local breweries and local craft distilleries used for cocktails.  Great concept and something that Charlotte is currently lacking.  But... Full disclosure,  I am a smoker.  A nasty habit, I know.  I went outside to an empty patio to drink and light up.  No complaints for almost an hour.  A manager comes up and mentions that we can't smoke on the back patio, but are welcome to move to the side patio to smoke.  All is good and we happily oblige.  A few minutes pass and a waitress tells us we can't smoke there either.  We mention that we were told to move there by a manager.  She tells us that she doesn't believe us and to put our cigarettes out.  We comply again.  A different manager comes out and asks the waitress if we are causing problems.  At no point were we rude, nor did we not do as we were asked.  I doubt that you will be successful if this is how you treat your customers.

Z-qtbUswrNdfXK-Q_xZzpA.text: Great place to come and hagn out for a brew or a little bite  Food looks awesome and service st the bar was great .

cD0vQzXCP1l-bS_PnxCG9Q.text: Fantastic brunch!! Also, in the heated/tented outdoor area you can bring your dog. It's awesome! Delicious food and great drinks. A solid new addition to Charlotte!

j7Ql1M34stA_dyhyi-DOAA.text: Super cute place! Love all the rustic decor with the greenery everywhere. Had a great latte which my husband had the coffee on nitro. I would've loved to check out the food or the beers but I think they only serve food on weekends. We'll definitely come back to try the food another time.

YZRRA4gaT4Dcaxjyy95-aw.text: First time shopper.....phenomenal burger!  While is past 12 did not indulge in the craft...on the clock. After hours for sure!!!

3XpuZx5yDxonDw_KJ2C6nA.text: The usual crew decided to come to our favorite Charlotte spot to celebrate a birthday. From the start, Deon offered incredible service and remembered every single detail of every order. We love this spot, and all 8 of us will be sure to come back thanks to Deon!!

94VlRkr5DNr5cVr32p-LOg.text: Food and coffee are good, but service is terrible. After ordering coffee, we were told we couldn't sit anywhere unless we also wanted to order brunch, so we had to stand outside to finish our coffee, which did not have a "to go" option.

HnXOabNdlqPnxaK8gEN95Q.text: I really think it is ridiculous that paying customers have to leave their tables even if they have a 150 dolars open tab and the waiter comes and asks us to leave our table "encourage" us and we wanted to order food. This is ridiculous

g70jJCh7MwQea9kf7PA1gw.text: Awesome find!! From the decor, to the menu, to the drinks, this place is great! I brought my family here on a Friday night for drinks and corn hole and they had a great time. This is the type of place that gets crowded but you can usually still hear yourself talking, which is a plus, especially in South End!

f-zSKI7ZP8CsFQVpvMVYYw.text: By far one of the best spots in Charlotte. The indoor dining is classic farm to table with an amazing beer menu. The grass fed burger is delicious and the citrus vinaigrette dressing on the mixed greens - I want to bottle it.  The atmosphere is even better.  Sit outside to enjoy the sun with your puppies, stop in after a run and bike ride on the light rail trail, or just pop in for a casual weeknight dinner.  Our new favorite place!!!!!

y54O6oT1EY4s0yctlRuqXQ.text: Horrendous service. We sat at the bar and the bartender was literally ignoring us. Granted his "bros" were sitting next to us so he probably was distracted but we waited 10 minutes to get a menu. He checked on his friends multiple times before going on break. When he finally went to say bye to his friends they said "I think they need their check" *insert head nod in our direction* and then proceeded to say "you need to step your game up bro".  We then paid and went outside to the bar out there. Giving two stars for the pimento cheese dip which was amazing and for the selection of beer.

gWa5WZ88gRnHRdHDjVWCjg.text: This is the best brunch I have had in a long time. I got the shrimp and grits and it was amazing. It had some spice to it so prepare yourself. But it was great. The drink menu also has a lot of great options. If you are in the area this place is a must visit!!

AnQaK3HJSMj3hALdnfcDgg.text: Went for a Saturday lunch but they had a brunch menu which was a pleasant surprise. I got the veggie burger and it was by far the best veggie burger I've had in Charlotte. The bbq sauce with goat cheese on it was really good. I usually am not one for bbq sauce  but this one was so good. It was not just sweet but it had a good spice to it. I also got the side salad and it was large for a side. I would definitely recommend the food and will be coming back for dinner sometime!

kCDoRb_XWB85J1c5ArWJsQ.text: Mike the bartender was very kind and helpful with my drink selection. Highly recommend sitting at the bar and chatting with this friendly lad!

8qoprFztG-b8WD4IeQdKHw.text: Such a great place to grab a beer and hang out on the patio. The food is fantastic and the bartenders are even better! Mike is super knowledgeable and makes great drinks, despite being an A's fan. I can't wait to drink my way through the entire new fall cocktail menu!

T4nKHOJshTJeKYQ7C26uDw.text: Had a business dinner here at it was a amazing!  Laid back environment with a modern decor. Great options on beer and wine!  The food was absolutely amazing!!  Had most of the appetizers and our favorites were fried pickles, shishito peppers, and pimento cheese with bacon jam. I had the short ribs and the portion was too big for me to finish. Highly highly recommend this place and def. will be back!!!

ijgTcW2gG7jMDOHL92NndQ.text: Went for dinner and drinks. Ordered the beer cheese and pretzels, pretzels tasted like days old bread and the beer cheese was COLD. The server told me it was intended to be served like that?!!!?!!!! Who wants cold beer cheese? Ordered the wagyu sandwich for dinner and while it was very salty, it was pretty good (I love salt). Fries were great. I love the atmosphere and will definitely be back again but never ordering the beer cheese and pretzels again.

iYNec-FGtkKPo_0cXQvDsQ.text: Went here for some after dinner drinks on a Friday night. It was definitely packed, but not so much that we couldn't find a place to sit. I had one of their signature cocktails and it was great. My husband had a beer. We really liked the outdoor area.  The reclaimed picnic tables were really cool and I loved how they had the fake grass under the tables. The inside was equally as nice. I would like to come back here and try the food.

ouhZllUyCywA96cWJ34QmA.text: Hard pass  Always love it but They refused to substitute chicken for pork.   The manager blamed it on the cook  Clearly a leadership issue.

ozdPtDPKZmv50VDBVG770w.text: I tried and I will give it a try again...  In browsing through Yelp pictures, there were a few things that caught my eye on the menu(s) and brought me in for lunch today (Ceviche, Pretzel and beer cheese and Suffolk Punch Burger) however the menu pics I saw were old and none of the above was on today's menu.  With that said, I was surprised to only receive a brunch menu at 12:30p and it wasn't until after ordering (something I wasn't really interested in) that on the website it stated "full menu available daily".  I wish my server had mentioned that the full menu was available but nevertheless I ate what I ordered and it was good.  I also wish I could've sampled a few beers before locking in on one or maybe there were flight options I was unaware of.  Next time I will go in with drinks on my mind and not necessarily food.  Maybe I should have said I was a first timer here and asked some questions. Next time...

EgxXk1XTPgnZiz_KUJKqiA.text: I'm so glad I got to come here!! I have had it bookmarked for a long time and finally made it. We sat at the bar because it was first come first serve.  There were two seats just waiting for us.  The service was great!  The bartenders all wait on you, do they were very helpful and attentive.  I ordered the mango habanero margarita...ok, 2 of them.  I could've had tons more because it was just that good.  This is how I wish every drink could be: perfect.  If you like spicy, I encourage you to try it.  Ignore the price and get it.  It was amazing.  I also tried the Hyde lavender saison.  I didn't care much for it, because all lavender tastes like soap to me.  It is, however, very unique.  The chicken biscuit with scrambled eggs and gravy was beautiful and very delicious.  I'd love to try some different menu items in the future.

qCnKgvyUdJwVTbumsEGU7w.text: Brunch was amazing here. We were seated immediately with a warm greeting. Everyone was in a great mood - perhaps it was the wonderful weather - but we had exceptional service  Some really cool things about this restaurant/brewery - they have great local beer prices for their Sunday brunch. We're talking $4 or less for a local beer, that's great in my opinion.  I ordered the chilaquiles- they were phenomenal. My friends ordered the French roast and the basic breakfast. No matter what the order - the food was cooked at a great temp, and it tasted fantastic. (Although I should point out that everyone agreed mine was the best, so order the chilaquiles if you can).  All in all - no complaints. The venue was clean - parking was easy to get. The neighborhood is walkable but a good way from downtown so would recommend driving. The bar is large so you could always get a seat there if there wasn't seating too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

7LpuH4tIukdRlRfnjMSk7A.text: Tried the Sunday brunch for the first time. I really enjoyed the French Toast- and recommend them highly! My friend had the Eggs Benedict but was disappointed with the eggs being a bit overcooked. Service was very good and the waiter was very helpful with choosing a great beer for the day

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Benedict

iyWx04YhIuTGDh7_lC5uFA.text: Great beer, good food, really relaxed and cool atmosphere/venue when it isn't stuffed with a ton of people. Getting drinks inside can be difficult sometimes.

3KJm1kgpYDykJHL-taQcig.text: I ate at Suffolk Punch on Saturday, March 3 for brunch with a girlfriend!  WOW!  I was torn between at least three menu items, and then had to stop our waitress and ask about the delicious looking items that were passing by us on their way to other patrons... Deciding FINALLY on the Shrimp and Grits was an arduous task, but SO worth it... I ate EVERY last BITE!  I also treated myself to their Apple Cider Old Fashioned which was simply lovely...   The service, the drinks, the FOOD, the beautiful atmosphere, and the sheer size of this place... everything appealed to me... I will be going back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

yIYz6Ww_lQEduq-IsaeBtQ.text: I went to brunch here on a Sunday and had a great experience! We sat ourselves outside. Out here you receive service by walking up to the outdoor bar. You don't have a server. At the bar you can get a menu, order drinks, and order food. We had the chicken biscuit, deviled eggs, and mimosas. All of which were so yummy. I think the only problem we had was when we asked for a coffee and tea menu, they told us we would have to go inside for that. So instead, we just didn't order any. That experience was 5 start but I'm keeping it at 4 for my past experiences.  Old review: The place overall has great decor and feel but the drinks are too expensive and the service has been rude or slow. I have been twice. The first time was the day after the soft opening and they were out of everything besides tea and coffee. I totally understood. But the only reason I knew this was because my friends who were already there told me. We were one of 3 groups there and when I walked in no one greeted me. I had no idea how the place worked. After waiting at our table for many minutes I walked up to the bar and tried ordering a tea. Long story the girl working was snotty and unhelpful. They also didn't have sugar for tea. The second time I went was a Saturday evening for drinks. After looking over the cocktail menu and seeing drinks ran about $13 or $10 for wines, my friend and I ordered well vodka sodas. They were fine. But upon receiving the bill they cost $28.50. Which would mean they were more expensive than the specialty cocktails. We asked the bartender and he shortly told us this is how it works there and all drinks are $13. So a house vodka with club soda costs the same as a gin special with a lemon twist, charred something or other, and some fancy flavor. I have never been to a place where the house wells are the same prices as specialty drinks and more expensive than nice wines. The bartender also seemed more busy with friends than with speaking to us. I voted a 3 because I have yet to try their food and love the inside.  A few weeks later we went back to try the food. The service was friendly but the food was undercooked and nothing to go back for. It was also odd that there was no option to tip on a gift card. We asked if she could charge us partially on our credit card so we could leave a tip and that was also not possible. We felt awful leaving without tipping but had no cash. So instead we left our gift card which had money left.

boboEh9-mWgSIX4kGVaoEQ.text: We have been here several times to ha g out and get drinks. I dont drink but everyone else likes their drink selection i talk to. We ordered food here one afternoon and we were pleasantly surprised at how exceptional the food quality was. We ordered fried green tomatos snd a hanburger with a side salad. The salad was our favorite dish. Hands down best vinegarette dressing with blue cheese. The burger was a perfect medium with great seasonings and the tomatos were ok. We did come back and have some amazing biscuits and gravy I highly recommend to biscuit and gravy lovers. This place is a great spot to hangout inside or outside when the weather is warm. Definitely give this place a try if you are thinking about it.

IwPpKPVFcPBnqFcLPutuGw.text: Beautiful area but the bartender was rude and ignored customers. My score is geared towards the staffs attitude and not the food and environment. We stood at the bar for over ten minutes before we finally had to ask if the place was even open. I will only go for beer when the outside bar is open now.

tPTUVFVp6_xIstdLZeauqg.text: Always crowded and for some reason they will put 2 people in a booth that can fit 6 so you end up waiting for awhile. And their wait time on Yelp does not work. Yelp has said 0 minutes and it's been over 30 minutes at least, this has happened multiple times. Once you finally get a seat (or fight on your own for a space outside) the food selection is small and overpriced. They have a great drink selection though.

Q0C08TgYgXM7N_2Nd8VfsA.text: I've been to Suffolk Punch a few times to get drinks. I love the location and the environment, but I don't love the menu. I have a very hard time finding food I will like there. I want to like the food, but I just don't. If you order food, there are more seating options. My friends have ordered food, but the only thing I'll eat is the hummus. It is good though.  Drinks on the other hand are great. They have a large beer assortment. It can be really busy on Sunday, but it's a good location for Sunday Funday.

Lyi8SM22tMKeCGcYcte6nQ.text: We love the drinks here! Amazing coffee program, awesome in house beer selection, but we waited twice as long to get sat than was anticipated. I got the english muffin with sausage and the egg and both were incredibly overcooked- there wasn't seasoning on the eggs... The muffins was small and couldn't hold the giant egg mixture inside it. Made myself eat it since it was $12 but not impressed! My husband ordered the burrito and said it felt as though they realized they forgot to order chorizo, onions and peppers and were trying to stretch it out to last the day. Amazing atmosphere and love the concept, but the food was a disappointment.

0d_bN4oD4K7SPJT6Q_7-Cg.text: So cozy!  They have TVs but they're not in your face.  Booth seating is extremely comfortable.  But even the chairs at the middle tables are nicely padded for my bony white ass.  The Cardinal gin is spiced!  It's amazing on its own and served on the rocks they put in one awesome giant ice cube.  Burgers are tasty!  They griddle the bun and burger in butter so if your lactose intolerant like me you just want to ask them to skip that.  The sourdough bread is a little heavy but the pickles are awesome.  Didn't care for the bacon jam, too much onion.  Fries are great!  The chips are a little over-done for my taste but I liked the mesquite smoked flavor.  Bathrooms are really nice!  And you walk by the giant brewing machines to get there.  Very cool experience.

XW9-BWi6hIEZys5Hy4FNUw.text: So, with my "No Land Meat" for Lent makes it a bit hard to find good things to eat. Not here mainly because they area Farm-To-Table location the salads are spot on and ridiculously fresh. With that I got the Vegi-Burger and let me tell you I would get that if I wasn't on the Lental hold out. I comes with a side salad, with sliced Granny Smith apples and blue cheese, not a fan of fruit in my salad but man, it so works here and may have pushed me towards fruiting my salad in the future. Back to the burger, what's in?... Well, no meat, that's all I got for ya. I didn't ask because I was wwwaaayyy too busy shoving it my face. I was on the clock so I couldn't par take of the many, many taps they have they most of which is their own brews from thirty feet away. As they are a brewery, which you can reserve a space and have dinner in the brewery; which they dim the lights down to create and amazing atmosphere. Lighting is key in this place with it's Steam Punk style decor it sets the mood for a chill, relaxing time and super convenient to the Light Rail. Plans are in the making for live music venue next door along with more plans fro the future. Eat, Drink, Tell

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baby wings are spectacular.

RIP88MI3hbIDxX96lRMzkQ.text: Sunday coffee here may be an under rated gem, can get in and out before the crowds roll in and enjoy a great cup of coffee/espresso/latte.  Pro tip: brunch offering is simple and elegant with a hard 3p cut off

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

INOKdpwHdUmVBo0qY31qog.text: I want to like this place SO BADLY but every single time I go I run into an issue. Bad service, limited menu, hours of operation changing without notifying anyone, hair in my food, beer not available... today was the last straw. I walked into their nearly empty restaurant to order breakfast. The four staff members stared at me like I was an alien. Finally, one of them was like oh it's seat yourself.  There was no sign. So we begin to get a seat and then he's like oh well you have to order at the counter. #okay so we go over to the counter and they have literally four options for breakfast. Damn. That's disappointing. I ask for a sandwich without bacon and you would have thought I had asked for the world on a silver platter. That was just a huge request for them to handle. So I walked out. Truly disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

YR3t9wSozsfMN4NYolBanQ.text: This is a restaurant I'd highly recommend to anyone local or visiting the Charlotte area. With a wide range of both food and alcohol selection set in a relaxed, thoughtfully designed indoor+outdoor space, you are certain to please all. Check out daily drink deals to aid your beverage selection, as this menu has a plethora of options including local beers, crafted cocktails, classic well drinks and wines.   Recommendations:  Breakfast (weekdays)- mushroom toast, avoacado toast Brunch (sat+sun)- vegetable hash, egg sammy  Lunch- farro salad, Reuben sammy  Dinner- veggie or regular burger, mussels small plate   Good for groups of any number or age. Relaxed ambiance during the day, but a great place to meet up socially later in the evening, as well. The area is spacious, so rarely too noisy! Cheers & enjoy this frequented favorite of mine on the CLT lightrail.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get Figgy with it (breakfast cocktail) + mushroom toast

zW2EPF5Sv4q3K2nlpb_TTQ.text: I came here with a couple of friends for a drink and food. The atmosphere is really nice. There's an outdoor seating area. I wish there was more bar seating or indoor seating though because every time we're here it's very crowded. On Sundays they have great drink specials! Their beers are pretty good - nothing exceptional through. My fiance and I split their reuben. It was amazing! I had one of their coffee cocktails (can't remember what it was called) and it was really good. I also had a cup of their regular coffee. This wasn't good at all. The women sitting next to me at the bar ordered it too and sent it back.

PxUloJvrRsVs1hURM_3Dug.text: I biked up to Suffolk Punch for some breakfast and coffee after hearing raves about this place. We met some friends and Hubs here for a late breakfast/brunch. The interior and patio are really cool and nicely decorated. It's modern farmhouse/coffeehouse vibe and the patio backs up to the lightrail greenway trail.   The ordering concept here is a little different where you order your coffee inside at the coffee bar and then order your food at a separate bar. It's order at the counter and they bring your food to your number/table. I really wanted one of the kids' meals but they said the chef would refuse. Some places are cool about that, but how does the chef know I'm not a kid? Is he/she going to come out and check to make sure? Weird. Anyway, I paid the extra $9 to get the adult breakfast of the same breakfast. My eggs were overcooked and pretty flavorless.   Everyone else enjoyed their breakfasts, like the sandwich and hash scramble. The coffee was also different, but good. I wouldn't rush back here, but it was okay to try out.

AFXw046_eQPu7Z4wonW3xA.text: Girls night out!! FANTASTIC ATMOSPHERE!! Food is DELICIOUS!! Must try the Frenched Wings and the Baked Pimento Cheese. SO YUMMY! Beer menu is extensive so there is something for everyone. And I love that they also serve liquor and wine for our friends that are not beer lovers. The patio, which is covered and heated in the winter is such a cool place to hang out. We loved The Suffolk Punch and definitely will be back.

atvpl1GFZAj7aaUp9i3trg.text: Four stars for a really gorgeous location and great drink specials. On Tuesday join them for half priced bottles of wine. Most of their wine is $30-35 for a bottle and $8-11 for a glass. You do the math and bring a friend.  Parking here was a bit tricky so walk or bike if you are in the neighborhood. I'm looking forward to another visit and trying more of their menu. However, the three apps I sampled were a little underwhelming.  The charcuterie plate is just that, with the only cheese being a crumbled blue - I wish that was noted on the menu. The spicy mustard on the plate is terrific. If you also order the pimento cheese app (there's your cheese!) they provide the same crostini for  dipping as is on the charcuterie  plate.  Come for the beautiful decor, comfortable chairs and kind service.

8gCQ0yb6Oeb1DexoNmUW8w.text: Food is on point. Started out with the pretzel sticks. Very tasty. The beer cheese was amazing. For my main course I got the pimiento burger with grilled onions and bacon. It was huge. Could not eat it all but it was tasty.  My co-worker has the small plate mussels and enjoyed it a lot. I ended the meal with the cream cheese brownie. It was so chocolatey and rich, could have paired well with a tall glass of milk. The service was awesome sometimes at breweries if you are drinking the service is not that good. Not here. It was great service.

d_TvgS4HMku405pVUBO7xQ.text: Was with an individual with food restrictions. The kitchen refused to accommodate. The manager said the chef didn't want to change a menu item.  Allergies should be accommodated.

uMFooFfgPCKK2roqEgNEqw.text: Food is ok. I have been here a couple of times, twice the food was too salty. Wish they had a larger selection for brunch. Beer is good. And coffee is delicious.

1yaMwWMfTO_vB7oY6UJomA.text: My family just finished eating brunch. We are stuffed and ridiculously satisfied. I'm a bit of a coffee snob lately and add a bunch of crap to my coffee to disguise the taste of bad roasts. I had the best cappacino and added nothing to it! It was perfect. The food was sin-sational. There was a little heat in the deviled eggs. The fried chicken on the chicken biscuit was seasoned with some cumin and lemon and all the goodness. We ordered extra chicken. I had the farro salad which was refreshing and filling. The service was excellent. Truly on point. The food rolled out quickly. Very attentive staff even if you ordered with a non wait staff person. Overall, they got it right the first time and every time. It was a great experience.

L4WPpwRB_eOmOFjStOQoOg.text: I came here for the first time on a Friday afternoon and it was packed! It was on/off rain, so the outside bar was closed, meaning that everyone was jam packed inside.  The ambiance and decor are very nice and trendy. We only went here to order drinks and the amount and variety of beers were very overwhelming. TIP: if you have never been here before, you order your beer by the number, not the name of the beer (which goes past 25).   The bartender service was horrendous though. I am reasonable and know that I am not going to get served right away, especially with the number of people that were there. However, I had to wait about 15 minutes standing right behind the bar to finally get someone's attention and order a beer.   Also, the bar area is right next to where people are sitting for dinner so it is very crowded in such a tight space. We were so close to one table that I felt like I was having dinner with them (which, if I were there to have dinner, I would have been annoyed by all of the people right next to me). Once we finally did get beers there is plenty of space down towards the back hallway area.   My biggest cons with Suffolk Punch would be with the inside layout as stated before. There is plenty of room outside (including outdoor games). I would like to give this place a try for food as the dishes did look delicious and when the weather is nice. However, if the weather is NOT GOOD or it is during the winter time where you do not want to go outside, I would not recommend this place as the inside is just too tiny to accommodate everyone in a comfortable space.

275WYmbtrQU1xuEOOJQQkQ.text: First off, this place is just OK to begin with but given that it is one of the only breweries that will take reservations I tried to book it for a birthday. After almost 2 weeks of trying to get an answer from someone I was told they are now all booked - I starting reaching out to them 3 1/2 weeks in advance from when I wanted to book and am now extremely frustrated at their poor follow up which has now led me to no reservation at all. They seem way too disorganized.

C4nD3lwk5nQC9W764NpzzA.text: I had the veggie burger and it was pretty yummy. My husband and I went during lunch on a Wednesday and it was not crowded. The service was great and I love the ambience of this place. We will def be back.

zxmzvCQARjR-VHQRvAkcew.text: Awful. We (4 of us) arrived at 2:00 for brunch. The place was no where near full, with plenty of open tables. The host and some other girl asked us "how hungry are you?" They proceeded to tell us that we could not be sat or served because the kitchen closed at 3:00... a whole hour later. There is no excuse to turn people away an hour prior to closing, unless you could care less about your business and making money. I have never heard of this in my life. TERRIBLE, terrible service. I would not recommend this place. Very disappointed.

_XMfhezTo9w2PfIfozQ9DQ.text: UPDATE: the owner Seth responded to my review immediately and corrected the situation. Thanks for the follow up.  See ya soon!  BAD NEIGHBOR: Suffolk Punch is s bad neighbor! After 12am when the staff is clearly ready to go home, they blast Semisonics, "Closing Time" at a volume so loud it is clearly done with the purpose to make their paying guest uncomfortable so that they want to go home.  The problem is they overwhelm the neighborhood using the outdoor speakers. This place sits on top of the light rail and the still able to overwhelm the neighbors with sound. Their act breaks all noise ordinances in Charlotte and there is never a cop around when you need one.  The

H8aVsBK__pjMhrNPK5wiUA.text: This place is always great! I wish they'd stop changing the menu all the time but the food is good just a bit pricey

v4svBMJt00eaxTeD01rF-g.text: Fun/hip atmosphere for cocktails.  Limited menu for food.  Parking is a challenge but plenty of random lots around there.

gSbnq7egjtC0pasWN0MR4g.text: First of all the parking is non-existent, so there's that... my party of 12 had to park blocks away and one person just said forget it, parked at my house a mile away and we ubered back to the restaurant (keep reading). All of this, to not be seated or served (keep reading). A friend made a reservation for my birthday 2 weeks in advance. She arrived early to made sure she would greet all arriving guests. The host said she saw the reservation and we would be seated shortly (keep reading). Only to be told 10 mins later, they didn't have our reservation and we could wait 30-45 mins to see if they would be able to seat us.... huh? WOW. What in the world? The "asst manager PATRICK" kept apologizing, but was not being helpful at all. Telling a group of 12 to wait up to 45 mins to be seated (mind you we had already been waiting about 30 mins) when we had a reservation from weeks before. This was my first time there, and LAST. It was very frustrating to see open tables that could accommodate us, however we were not made a priority at all. Other parties that had not arrived were put ahead of our needs, even though we were already there and waiting AND DID I MENTION WE HAD RESERVATIONS. I would love a formal apology from a representative of this establishment. It was a joint birthday celebration that was tarnished with unprofessionalism and mass confusion. I am big on customer service so for nothing to be offered for our inconvenience at the time of incident really puts a bad taste in my mouth FOREVER. If they don't get it together, they wont last - there are a million places to go in Charlotte and if your service isn't top notch, you will end up like all the other restaurants that have opened and closed in less than 3 years, GONE.  P.S. We ended up at Napa on Providence - they were wonderful and accommodating, go there for a quiet quaint brunch!  Sincerely... I will never be a customer, Alyssa W.

sY_yXtLgpn1rgofTSw5igQ.text: We decided to come here and try the brunch. I was worried it wouldn't be great, but I really enjoyed the shrimp & grits. I love the vibe of this brewery and will be back again for brunch. It does get really busy so be prepared to wait at least an hour to sit inside or you can try to fend for yourself and fight for an outdoor table.

s6XZEM4m3Ee6Z8g-tapbNQ.text: My favorite brunch spot currently!! Everything I've tried is good but their fries are so good, I can never resist. Sad they got rid of the pecan crusted French toast, it was my friends favorite item. But great atmosphere and service and the food is consistently great!

-BR4kyhtZX88b3qU6H3DBg.text: Oh my goodness. I came in for lunch and got the burger and fries... this meal comes in the top 3 of all the burgers and fries I've had in my entire life. The burger was juicy and cooked to perfection and the seasoning on the fries is addicting for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

fWf-c5uHL-mJByhoQ3nykg.text: Food is delicious, service great and the atmosphere is awesome! Check this one out, one of my favorites!

PvVxShxZrULDrRGMweiTDA.text: Their chicken wings are as good as how their service is bad... we were there twice and couldn't get seated because the restaurant decided to stop seating 1 hour and 45 minutes before the kitchen turns over, not even to get a drink. ...sat at the bar which had super slow service. Also do the hostess people do anything besides stand there looking aimlessly

IQjAiwIWRBfI8HLz2iCdRw.text: The food here was a great tapas style experience - really nice for sharing with a couple friends (which is what we did). We had the crab croquettes (great), pork belly (okay), wagyu sandwich (delicious), toasted quinoa salad (amazing sun dried tomato dressing), pretzel sticks with beer cheese (wow!!), and also got a flight of beer.   Unfortunately, we weren't fans of any of the beer we selected (but found another brewery nearby that had a really great beer selection).   The setting here is great for friends and we were glad there was no wait for dinner on a Saturday night.

EyWchNPl-ocW-vvk_gI0fg.text: Beautiful spot to grab lunch or dinner, the ambiance is really cool, with hanging plants as chandeliers and a really cool bar area, along with a huge outdoor eating patio right next to the train.  I had the chicken sandwich, which was juicy and expertly prepared, and our server Deon was excellent, and had great recommendations. He even managed to get us back behind the scenes and get a tour of the brewery and to meet Mr. Hyde himself!
