_RjyPOkcBnjODXXSKgWFrw.text: Loved this place, it was very cold but we sat at the heated patio and were able to enjoy the beautiful sunny day outside. I couldn't believe how good their coffee is! They have this vanilla latte with amazing ingredients, so definitely worth to try their coffee bar.  Outside we got the Suffolk scrambles and the burger, it was 2pm and they were out of some dishes already, which tells how fresh and good their food is.  Can't wait for my next visit!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla latte (oat milk), mimosa and Suffolk burger

bx-MlWvmL1f8zrZpRiVUaw.text: I had a review for Hyde Brewing but I believe they absorbed fully into Suffolk Punch now! So I will write a review for Suffolk! It's a wonderful place that's very appealing to the eye. Very tastefully decorated. They have a long bar with lots of different beers including other breweries aside from theirs. They also have a craft coffee bar separate from their alcohol bar. But you can still order from your waiter off the menu.   They are located right off the light rail so just a very quick walk from New Bern station. They have a solid outdoor patio area that is covered and heated throughout the year depending on the weather. But no pets are allowed in the tent so be ready for that!   The wait staff are friendly but they definitely can get busy! It's centrally located around a lot of other cool places down in South Charlotte too!

GKtFwQDLh_jawXfh8yHp1w.text: I am not quite sure what to think of this place yet, do not get me wrong, the food was delicious. They offer an eclectic menu, from Asian to traditional Southern.  Ok here is why i'm a bit confused: It's a brewery which is clear, when you enter. I feel you enter in the back, because you have to go down this long "hallway" to reach the hostess station. You can see the dining area off to the side and a very long wrap-around bar in the center with the brewery displayed on the back of it. The bar is so large and feels a bit overwhelming that it comes off that the dining area was just an after thought. Like "oh people drink here...maybe we should serve food" aaaaaaaaaaaand it's also a coffee bar. So yeah, I feel this place is trying to be so many things, that I can't really categorize it, perhaps that's the point. Maybe I have this opinion, because we came here during lunch and perhaps has a different feel during the happy-hour, night-time crowd.  Went here with a party of 3, so we got to order a lot of stuff - The Suffolk Punch Burger - I really liked this. Whole grain mustard is my fave and shaved onions and the sourdough roll are just the cherries on top. Definitely order this, if you are unsure and want to order something solid. - Grilled Chicken Sandwich - the BF was not quite a fan, he ordered it and his opinion was more of a "meh", chicken tasted bland and was more of a "pulled" chicken style. (He regretted his order and wished he  had gotten the burger too LOL) - Crispy Korean Rock Shrimp - we both liked this, the glaze paired really well with the aioli. - Frenched Wings - red glazed wings were also good.  As you can see their menu is eclectic and maybe that is their niche a little taste of everything with your coffee or brew.  Drinks, they obviously have coffee, brews, but no fountain soft-drinks. Originally asked for a Dr. Pepper, but the server apologized that they do not have a full bar. They do have Coke, but it's the glass bottled versions - no refills!  Reason I gave deductions is that parking is horrible there and because they do not have soft drink fountain. For being a restaurant and having this huge bar, they should have fountain drinks. Especially being open for lunch, brunch and dinner / happy hour.  Will I come back, of course - that Suffolk Punch Burger was bomb! but i'd probably carpool.

gK5FLAsh251Mkt0byj0I1Q.text: The location of Suffolk Punch was really unexpected as it is hidden and kinda random. However, I loved it! I got the chicken sandwich with chips and it was delicious! A little on the saltier side, but very flavorful. I also ordered a Warm Spice Latte and that was very good as well. I tried a bit of the burger and they know how to make a good burger! The meat was tender and I believe they used tomato jam (or some kind of jam).   The service sucked though because they were super busy and I am pretty sure there was only one waiter.

BGriEw7-w80LaTsTscKkmw.text: Fried chicken and biscuits is pretty good. Very crispy, great flavor, and a huge portion. Very chill hangout spot for brunch, and will get super crowded. The server was telling us they weren't going to be able to put any orders into the kitchen for another 20 to 30 minutes. It did discourage some of us from ordering. We ended up having to wait quite a while for the food. People fighting for tables and benches outside weren't too much fun as we had a large group and not everyone showed up together. Wait might be better during less busy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

XKZMdiPIIezfD9NOugRdhw.text: The Suffolk Punch is a great spot for a variety of events! The concept of having a Brewery, Culinary Cafe, Taphouse, and Coffee bar is incredible. The interior is quite spacious with many seating inside and outside. The Chicken and Biscuit was delicious, but we ordered a side of Roasted New Potatoes and it was as if they were the last bit before putting in a new batch, it was quite discouraging. Overall, the environment was delightful and we will definitely need to come back for the dinner menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Biscuit, absolutely delicious!
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exterior Views.

9Ma3krMlbw5H1aQ7vPV7VQ.text: This place has a great setup inside and makes it have a very homie feel to it with all the decor and lights.   I love the location of this place because it's literally a sneeze away from the light rails New Bern exit.  I met with a couple of friends to grab some food and some drinks. It was National Burger day so they had $9 specials for a burger and fries. I feel like getting a burger/sandwich so I ended up going with the Wagyu sandwich.  The Wagyu had shaved beef with some flash fried onion rings and a horseradish sauce which was deluctant.  For beer I sat around with my friend just tasting what beer made sense with our food choices. I went for one of the coffee stouts, not sure the name but the bartender will sure be happy to help and then went for Introduce the Juice, a New England IPA from Hyde brewing.  We ordered the drinks and food at the bar, took the drinks outside and then we had a number where the food would be delivered right to us, except my friend who ordered the nachos and got them at the bar immediately before we ever ordered our brews; talk about fast.  This was a great spot to hang out and unfortunately the coffee bar was closed, but hopefully next time I'll get to try some of their craft coffees.

Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu Sandwich

iW9tfZ_srvwTQaC6oBGxFw.text: Best place for brunch. GREAT Atmosphere. Nice employees and awesome selection of beers and coffee drinks. First time ever here today and it definitely won't be the last. So glad they have designated parking for this place. But one could also take the light rail in. The decor is awesome and rustic too which is my favorite. I'd give it more than 5 stars if I could.

CAho1Z8hsRzVSzne2_sOSA.text: When Hyde Brewing/The Suffolk Punch opened, it appeared to be two different entities. I lived right beside it so I was like, why not, let's go check it Out. I have loved it ever since from the bartenders/wait staff to the decor and food (not the brunch I had, but I'll get to it).   SP/HB has an amazing beer special every Thursday and Sunday, ALL DAY, that has all of THEIR awesome craft beers $3; which includes about 34 different choices and counting.   I really just wanted to inform everyone on my brunch experience I had with the food. This is why I took off one star. I ordered the huevo rancheros for $13 and was highly disappointed for the following reasons:  1) It took them forever to bring it out.  2) The temperature on the food, @ best, was luke-warm to cool.  3) It wasn't huevo rancheros (no crispy anything) 4) It was an extremely small portion (see photo) and I was still hungry .   All in all, I would definitely recommend going here but don't get the Huevo rancheros. You will be highly disappointed. Instead, get the fried chicken biscuit or something other then the aforementioned item.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huevo Rancheros - two sunny side up eggs || Black bean purée || avocado crema || marinated slaw

75wg9TjHLGEQWpgh7KYIUA.text: Melding of the best worlds: Tap house (Hyde Brewery) meets coffee bar meets restaurant here at this unique spot. It literally meets any craving you may have. My favorite time to come here is for brunch because it's acceptable to eat, drink beer, and coffee all at the same time!  They brew their own beer here so you can guzzle down some Charlotte made brews while eating good food instead of your typical bar food.  My go-to brunch items: - Shrimp N Grits: My favorite in Charlotte, hands down. This dish is perfectly savory and spicy, with NC shrimp, chorizo, okra, peppers, Anson Mills grits, scallions, and creole sauce. It's got a kick that doesn't leave it bland and boring like some other places.  - Chicken and Biscuit: if you're hungry, this massive breakfast sandwich is sure to fill you up! It's a scratch made biscuit with scrambled eggs, fried chicken, and peppercorn-chive gravy poured on top. - Buckwheat and Quail: this dish is a popular one! These wonderful buckwheat johnncakes are topped with flash fried Georgia quail and whipped butter, with a smearing of house made blueberry syrup. I love the flavor combination with the quail and blueberries.  My seasonal drink: a creation they make in the winter time -- Cottonheaded Ninnymuggins, which is whiskey, coffee, and house made peppermint syrup topped with marshmallows... to DIE for!  The atmosphere here is really cool! You can sit at the bar and enjoy a short visit, or stay longer at a high top to get some work done or in a booth/at a real table to really indulge. There's also a great patio area for enjoying the nice weather, with a handful of large TVs, an awning, and a outside bar.

dUTGw6Zpv1QlsqA558LniA.text: Tried this place for the first time on Memorial Day and was disappointed in the limited menu as we were told they were swapping menus the next day. Probably 4 out of 5 dishes we would have tried were unavailable. The food and cocktails that we did have were good.   The service - although almost two hours from start to finish - seemed as if our window was rushed each time the server or food runner visited the table. Any question we had seemed to come with a labored and hasty response in answering.   I would try again, but I would call ahead and make sure you're getting the menu you're signing up for with no limitations. I also hope our customer service was a fluke.

7O7zjl3oQd7qgs7Sz-FIoQ.text: Great neighborhood spot in Southend that also has a brewery inside. It's right off the light rail, they serve local beers, cocktails, and food. It has a very relaxed atmosphere to it, sometimes you can catch live music on Friday or Saturday nights. They've got $3 local beers Thursday and Sunday's so that's pretty hard to beat as well, and to top it off they've got great food, highly recommend the buffalo shrimp and the pork wings!

Qa1rwH17OM5YMkwZ-xmWzQ.text: We have been here a handful of times and the bar service is always the same - extremely slow and you have to flag someone down, even if you are sitting at the bar... we came here yesterday with friends and it was monsooning out and so the bar wasn't even that busy out and even still, the service was the same as it always is. This time the bathrooms were a disaster and very unkempt. Toilet paper all over the place, the trash can overflowing with paper towels. Clearly they are not checked on all that often. We have been wanting to try their food and will most likely go one more time to give it a try but unfortunately we have no desire to come back just to drink. We do like the ambiance of the place.

ROahxzazJV-wL3XLtXHJRg.text: Suffolk is a cool looking place in South end. It's got a nice big bar & a really nice outdoor area right off the light rail. I got there early on a Saturday and did the wait-list app on Yelp and it was very off... Said 5-15 wait and it was more like 30 minutes. The host & hostess were super nice and I didn't mind waiting. Our server was very sweet and fast especially for how busy they were. It was only 7:30pm and they were slammed.  The grilled chicken sandwich seemed slightly undercooked and was not great. The pimento cheese app was delicious though! My friend enjoyed her mussels.  All in all I'd pop back in here but probably for drinks and I'd take Uber or light rail. The parking was horrible ... Only one tiny lot and barely any street parking bc of Triple C across the street.

koX4QFTlaxfag5Qwd9S02A.text: Ambiance is great. Drinks and food are so overpriced it's ridiculous. Food also was meh at best. Got the chicken sandwich for $16 and was not good at all. Been a bunch of times and it's always just been ok. But definitely a cool hangout spot just expensive and service is lackluster at best

lmQaCnMM7P-LpgpxVsxxpw.text: I love this place. It's such a cool concept! A culinary cafe serving up all your favs...you want coffee, beer and brunch? They have it all.   We sat at the bar and all of the bartenders were so helpful and informative. I ordered a mango habanero margarita and it was soooo good. If you don't try anything else here and like it a little spicy...this is the drink for you!   I also shared the chicken and egg biscuit with sausage crazy. It was very tasty as well. I loved how well everything blended together. I'd absolutely order it again, but there are so many delicious options on the menu that I'm looking forward to trying everything!   I'm looking forward to my next visit!

A7ikv9SWN1gU8zTzCKoxcw.text: Farro salad add spinach. Yummy and seasonal. Loved the roasted squash. Exactly what I wanted on a sunny, Fall afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

R8O_FyAMdeoRXm1AsP3oXg.text: Nice place to hang out during day time. They have a coffee bar also - which is great. I have only tried the veggie burger here. Was okay /not bad.

RZZT_MJ_2Nq35mpfZ5XVKQ.text: My girlfriend Tina and I wanted to have breakfast somewhere different so I checked Yelp and found this little gem! I'm so glad we came. I had the best breakfast! Quail and buckwheat pancakes. OMG. Don't knock it until you've tried it. That little piece of protein was crispy and cooked to perfection! It packed out real fast so if you're coming for Saturday breakfast get here early if you want a table!  See you next time. We're coming back!

oNxYdeUHOS1mTgjpHe_bqg.text: This place is new and awesome. The bacon app is a must have! After we ate we sat outside. Artificial grass outside and plants in the center of the tables gives the allure that are you aren't by a bunch of warehouses.

HEyEAaOligcXZfSQUhPrNQ.text: Awesome food! Awesome beer made in house. Great space for March Madness and enjoying the St. Patrick's Day scenery:) very unique menu with delicious southern inspired food.

Vs0UmORvP_zi3fwCawzhVg.text: Awesome spot. Had a great Easter brunch. Food, drinks and service were great!!!  Super tasty menu and drinks were unique and yummy!  We dined inside and then moved outside. Really cool atmosphere and perfect sunny day. Can't wait to return!

Iyc6fXDnaK9lZE4ZXNPz3w.text: I have been so excited to try this spot and was equally disappointed with my experience. The two stars are for a few of the cocktails and most of the food we shared. We got there at 730 on a Sat and were given a 90 min wait time...at around 930 we got seats at the bar and patiently waited for the apps we ordered about 20 minutes prior. After we finally received our apps, we enjoyed them without cocktails because no one bothered to check on us again. While most of the food and drinks  were good, I do not recommend going here if you want prompt service and/or are hungry.

RdiPsVjteR3fTHWyziR8qw.text: Loved it. Bacon was amazing.  Beets and goat cheese was fantastic as well. Loved the unique beers and sours on tap.  Great vibe on the inside. Burger wasn't cooked as ordered (med well). Several items sold out and service was a little slow but would not stop us from coming back. We can't wait to go back.  Great for a date night or with a group of friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

-mAwcC3ZT6GArceZ6FwY5g.text: Had an amazing meal with my parents (who are extremely hard to please)!  The atmosphere is fabulous, we sat outside, which will be perfect this fall with the heat lamps and outdoor TV's. They really did a top notch job with the interior decor and patio space.    We ordered a little bit of everything to try the Menu. Everything was really fresh, quality and served piping hot. Service was also very good.   Probably one of the best experiences in Charlotte for a casual dinner, especially in Southend, which was much needed!

-3MEVvU1EuFwRelTcl9fsA.text: Stopped in for a morning cold brew on a hot day and I am glad I did. I love the space inside and out. I need to go back to try dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loved the cold brew and loved the space. I stopped by on a run and was glad I did.

nlENCtbxP05mHLKdUXk0nA.text: Hex is delicious and Brandon was the most amazing barista that I have ever come across!  This is always my spot when I come into town for drinks and now I'll be coming in twice a day.  Cannot say enough wonderful things about Brandon and Mike.....and the place altogether.  Almost makes me want to move back.

C7n0Qvm30UM3NnUDnaE61w.text: Enjoyable atmosphere, great brewery with plenty of vegan options. Service a little slower than what I would feel comfortable with.

OOIXk8KvrW1eVCdNLrnBOg.text: Beautiful place food is great but the atmosphere is lacking.... It's like it's missing something fun or exciting. Expensive drinks $12 each are full of ice. Way to much ice in a $12 drink. Good staff just boring. After dropping $30  with tip for 2 icy drinks we left not staying for the food. This was my 2nd visit first had the waguBurger. Really delicious. Beer brewery but need more wine choices.

zjcE8uNZfy6kT6X7qPDUgQ.text: Never been to a place that could mess up on a burger, especially in Charlotte.  The meat was completely burnt on the outside.  We had to pick off all the char, but it still tasted burnt. My boyfriend mentioned it to the waiter,  but he only apologized in a non-chalant way and walked off. Service isn't great here too. It was our first time.  Unfortunately, we were given a gift card, so we'll give it one more chance.

bnFkTUekkMnYM7y-CbH-kQ.text: Love this place for brunch. The space is warm and inviting with a rustic/industrial feel. Staff is very friendly and quick to deliver. I am a big fan of the fried egg sandwich. Great portion size and big on flavor. Hubby got the chicken and biscuit which was pretty tasty. The beers are pretty good. Wish they had as many coffee cocktails as they had the first time we were here, but I won't hold that against them. Overall, very good and well worth our 45 minute drive to Charlotte.

kG_3CW6gtqayfwcgNanpvw.text: I really love the atmosphere here especially the outside area in the back. They have TVs on the patio as well which is great for football season. The menu on the patio is pretty limited, but you can go inside more more options. It's right next to the light rail which is pretty key as well

d77qCbvB8OG2LYsgDGs29Q.text: So I am a restaurant manager for well known restaurant... I have to say that I was Wowed and I can not say that about very many places.....I have to say to say from the host to server and manager that I was supper impressed... the food was good but that is not what sold me.. Tyler was our server and I do want to give him A+   Thank you!

1EBGDU58LxNRiKfcjmuRhA.text: I got the veggie burger. It was pretty good but it wasn't that filling. I think the veggie patty could have been thicker and the burger could've come with a couple other toppings to make it more filling. I also thought the fries portion on the side was a bit small. I could tell because I was running out of fries with a good amount of burger still left to eat. They have a nice lively atmosphere inside and an extensive drink menu, although I'd say their beer and cocktails are overpriced. I guess that's the trade off of it being a convenient location to where a lot of people live.

gmnWiqT2yApibFyCxkUakA.text: Suffolk Punch is using deceptive wait-list management. They have signed up with the NoWait app service which is used by good handful restaurants in Charlotte to manage wait-lists. It showed "no-wait".  But, Suffolk Punch is not updating their queue in it, so that it looks like they are always able to handle traffic and customers without wait. However, when you arrive at the restaurant, the nonchalant answer is, "Oh yeah, we know about that, but it is 1.5 hours wait." And, then, blame the "algorithm" for their mistake of proper management and usage of the list.  This drives additional traffic to their restaurant without any hope of serving them. This is very deceptive. No idea how their food is, however, I will not return to any restaurant that tries to trick me into visiting.

AdkmIYqoxucf_uvF1LqxhQ.text: This place has a good atmosphere minus the bro scene/young professional southend vibe. Some of the bar tenders can be rude...not really a relaxing place compared to others.

XBTY1hbsEBfHSrifOWf5Hw.text: Went to Suffolk on Sunday to eat brunch and my friend brought her dog inside the outside "beergarden" and there were NUMEROUS dogs in there. There were even dogs on the tables....and no one said a thing. I go back with my dog on Friday and go to the outside "beergarden" yet again to watch the UNC game. We asked the host if dogs were allowed and she said yes. We got our drinks, ordered food and hungout at the table. My dog was doing nothing wrong, just sitting there not bothering anyone and a worker comes up and says that dogs arent allowed and he walked away. Because of my previous experience where dogs were allowed, we stayed. The man came back, when we had our food and told us if we didnt go outside that we would be kicked out. He didn't even offer to move our food outside. I asked him how merely a few days ago dogs were allowed inside and tonight mine wasn't and he said "listen, my boss told me to tell you, i'm just doing my job." K. So my boyfriend quickly finishes his food and takes our dog outside. I close out our tab (couldn't imagine spending another dollar at this place) and the dude behind the bar asks how everything was and i said good, minus the fact a few days ago dogs were allowed in here and now i'm being told mine isn't. The only response this guy can think of is, "Oh its subjective. It really just depends on the day. But hey, we're taking the covering off on 4/8 so come back with your dog then....no thanks. The inconsistency is ridiculous and the fact no one knew WHY my dog wasn't allowed is absurd.

AHDUoVgkbzh1ob7yQhyrJg.text: Lunch at the Punch!  Wow!  Ordered the BLT with a side salad.  I wish I had more stomachs to order another one!  Great, fresh food made from real ingredients.  Service was awesome and I'd come back every chance I get.  And their outdoor patio has tables with live plants built into them.  Pretty cool...

MlMoBam6_ZIoh_y-D8-OJQ.text: I was finally able to stop in and try this place out!  The espresso was ok, definitely not my favorite but I tried the Suffolk Punch burger and it was fantastic! Also, Walker was extremely hospitable and awesome! Will return for sure!

UoCC4Wlt7mXZ_OD2ue_fPA.text: The entire experience in trying to get a drink or food is unfortunate. Plenty of help. You will wait at minimum 20-30 minute at bar to get a drink. We sat at the bar and couldn't get waited on. I clocked it, waited 45 mins for a server to notice us...at the bar.

wE8hSsnJUmC099cFAIq4jw.text: After driving around for 15 minutes trying to find parking (without parking blocks away), I attended what was supposed to a joint birthday brunch for two friends on Sunday, October 14th.  My friend who made the reservation was there 20 minutes before the reservation time to be sure everything was secure, which was confirmed by the hostess and to greet the rest of the guest as they arrived.  All guest were there promptly by the reservation time of 12pm; about 10-15 minutes later the manager on staff that day came over and advised that they did not have the reservation, though he was reading the exact reservation details from the iPad he had in hand. He then proceeded to say that they will not seat us and was giving our table to another group who's party wasn't even there yet.  My friend explained that these reservations were made two weeks ago and confirmed three days prior as to the number of guest and all details were confirmed. The manager kept saying he doesn't know what happened to the reservation and said we would have to wait an additional 30-45 mins before a table would be available after we had already been waiting about 30 mins, Mind you a high top table had a reservation sign on it with my friends name, so no one would be seated there. The manager told her that was for someone else who supposedly had the same name. At that point we decided to leave and go elsewhere. The customer service was very disappointing as there was no effort to make accommodations for our party after the staff messed up on their side.

mRTzRJ0GPQZBMstCsXJXCA.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte hands down! This will definitely be one of my summer spots and the customer service is sooo good. My mom, sister and I visited this place this past Saturday around 1 in the afternoon. We sat outside on their back patio area and the weather was absolutely gorgeous. We sat ourselves then went up to the counter and ordered a carafe for mimosas and our food. The bartenders in and outdoors were friendly and made great drinks. I believe outside you could only get bloody marys and mimosas but inside is where I ordered our second round of drinks. My long island ice tea was average, my sister loved her cucumber drink and my mom enjoyed her bloody mary. The food came out speedy and piping hot! I had shrimp and grits which were perfectly seasoned. The atmosphere is what I love most about this place. Its honestly one of those places you just have to try out for yourself because my description won't do it justice. I also like the crowd. Very laid back, friendly, and it was somewhat diverse. Its located in the beautiful and constantly developing south end area of Charlotte. Do yourself a favor and check this place out on an early Saturday afternoon. You'll thank me later.

hdOoYYldDNGcZFQPSU52_Q.text: I can't review the food or drink because we did not actually stay. When we arrived after using the app to "reserve" our place in line, we were told there was an "issue" with app and the wait was not 15 min (as the app indicated) but more like an hour (or more). It would have been nice (since they had our number) to contact us an let us know since clearly they were aware this was happening before we drove all the way there and checked in with the hostess. Just a little proactive service goes a LONG way... we probably still would have gone, but since they didn't feel too horrible about wasting our time before we even sat down, we didn't feel it was going bode very well for the overall service.

3E-7Dtj3NVQeI0P8675yBg.text: A+ for the atmosphere. It is gorgeous. B-/C+ for the service and D for the prices.  I went in to order a simple coffee drink. It was not that busy. However, I waited in line for 10 minutes with only three people in front of me because the barista was so chatty.  I ordered a specialty latte - SEVEN DOLLARS (due to locally sourced milk, apparently) - and it was not even that good. (A cold chocolate cinnamon drink, which sounds good, right? It was watery and flavorless.)  The only way I'd come back was if someone else was paying for me. Ridiculous!

A_4CgWVTX-8dB42O8sC_rw.text: Great atmosphere, great service, great food- Looking forward to going back tomorrow!!

jLxENLYGQTuOCRwKXqlTnw.text: ahhh... so much potential!!!  If I had to rate The Suffolk punch purely on decor and ambiance, I'd give it a whole 5 star rating. Unfortunately, there's so much more to consider. The food was average at best, the service was really quite terrible (the drinks took foreverrrrr to get to us, some things never made it to us at all, our server kept disappearing for long periods of time) The first time we went there in the morning for a cup of coffee, we were so excited because 1) the coffee was awesome 2) the decor was even more awesome. We couldn't wait for them to be open for dinner. and when they were, we decided to check it out with some friends. We ordered a lot of food, almost everything on the menu - from the potato croquettes to the foie gras popcorn, from the beet salad to the pickles, the punch burger to the market fresh fish - and while non of the food was terrible, none of it was memorable either. The overall experience however was a memorable one because it was expensive and underwhelming.  The drinks that did make it to our table were good, but when you have to wait 20 minutes for a drink, they ought to be amazing - either the drink menu needs to be simplified, or the bar service upped. There's tremendous unrealized potential here... perhaps things will improve with time?

AfYVAehAad8giT0ZbZvFMg.text: We had a fantastic night celebrating girls night at Suffolk Punch! I had the risotto with roasted vegetables and I added shrimp. It was delicious! Although I didn't partake in the brew the drinks were on point and the atmosphere fantastic for a night out!

ZMWGqgW5VuKgCqcZs9MDuQ.text: Great veggie burger and the service was fantastic! The 16 Hands IPA and the Maple Bourbon Old Fashioned were amazing!

do_ocXiq-iW1wDNaPEdOEA.text: Atmosphere is awesome.  Great job integrating the  outside space with the inside space.  Food and service were both great!

ny3hTGASEJ9ysb3m8i50FQ.text: Came in on a Saturday evening around 5pm. It was the day of the Kentucky Derby so things were very busy. We put our name down at 5:26pm for a party of 8 to be seated inside for dinner. The hostess gave us an estimated time of 15-20 minutes. Suffolk has a systems where they text you and you can view your place in line.. after about 15 minutes we were at the top of the waitlist and were to be seated next. Around 6pm (30 minutes after we put our name down) we see two tables open, one with 7 chairs and one with 6. We assume we will be seated soon so we get excited.. until a 7 top that was clearly behind us on the waitlist grabs the table and asks the hostess if that was their table and if they can sit there. The hostess says yes and they get seated before us although we were at the top of the waitlist for awhile now. We saw this, went over to the hostess and asked what happened and how much longer the wait was. The hostess says that since our party was 8 they had no space for us... although they literally could have grabbed ONE chair and put it at that table. She then decided to tell us that she had "no idea anymore" when we were going to be seated. It went from 15-20 minutes to "no idea." We totally understood that the place was busy and people were sitting at their tables longer than expected to watch the race. However, seating the 7 top before us was absolutely ridiculous. The hostess then decides to seat a 6 top at the other empty table claiming that they did not have enough chairs for us. There were clearly a few chairs around the restaurant that were not in use.. they were just being lazy at that point. In the end, we ended up wait 1.5 hours!!! Until we finally asked the hostess again what her honest opinion was on the wait and she told us that if it were her, she would leave and find another place. As soon as we all leave and get in our ubers, we get a text at 7:01 pm that our table was ready. What a horrible first experience for all of us. Management, please train your staff to properly seat tables. Just because a group sits down and asks if they can sit there doesn't mean you let them. You have a wait list for a reason and people should not be allowed to cut others. Guests understand that you are busy and are willing to wait longer on a busy day but failing to properly seat people in order is unacceptable.

_WTgTb8P7oMUVrPwGLAZxw.text: Pretty pricey but good food and beer! Plenty of room to just hang out! I like the beer samples but wish they offered a flight!

H2LRlFf1ThfIN0N3HrNv0A.text: Incredible food and drinks, great ambiance, unique menu, and friendly wait staff. Can't ask for anything more.

APwvsju38MgVcvBaH9_x7w.text: Great atmosphere, great food, really good beer. I don't think they quite have a handle on the capacity versus the kitchen. If you want food fast, this isn't the place for you. But once you do get their food, its delicious. Definitely worth the wait. I'm sure the longer they are open, the more efficient they will get. I will definitely be going back.

u0IDCebxOc4QYADZQMlcwA.text: We sat at the bar on opening night and while the service was not perfect it was much better than I would expect for their first night. The interior is amazing, plants everywhere and overall great vibe. Our food was good but not great. It was beautifully presented but both the heirloom tomato salad and the farmed cucumbers while good seemed to lack a little something that would make them great. We will definitely try them again.

eijCVAEHzPGMvP_ABwSHwQ.text: Could not wait to get here and get the chicken gravy biscuit. Planned my whole Saturday around driving here from Lake Norman.  They opened at 10am for brunch and lunch so I got there at 12.  I was told by the hostess there was an hour and a half wait to be seated although there were six booths completely empty.   Hostess told us we could go out to the patio and sit out there and could still order food from the bar on the patio.  Great. No problem.  Go out to the patio, plenty of seating, go to the bar to order some food and we're told that we can't place any food orders for another 20-30 minutes so the kitchen could catch up.    ????????  We were also told that we couldn't even pre-order our food.  We would still have to wait 20-30 minutes.   I really don't get this place. 1st restaurant I've ever been to that says you can't order food. The wait was annoying but what made it worse was the hostesses and the people at the bar.  Like it was OUR problem that we couldn't order any food. Not theres.   No need to ever go back.

OY5eWhLKlyRqWHlWbuue-Q.text: Love some Pimenta Cheese and Bacon jam. Combine them together for a real treat! No but seriously, just order one of everything and see if you can fit it all on the table. I think it's worth it. - Rockett

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

azDszHR9UM8Iycu6SN9XuA.text: This coffee bar - brewery - restaurant is destined to be my new favorite spot. Walkable, 48 beers on tap and more to come, the food is artfully prepared and the patio is refreshing with its sailcloth sunshades, AstroTurf grass and herbs growing from the middle of the wooden farmhouse picnic tables. Open from dawn till late night, you can stop in and grab your morning coffee, provided by Lindsey Pittman and Hyde Coffee. Return for an after work beer and dinner or small plates.   Must try: Suffolk Punch Burger. Seriously.   I had the steak (delish) and tasted the chicken (also amazing), but the burger was by far the best thing we tried all night. The pickled garnish on top made it. The fries that come with the burger are also to die for. They are salty enough to keep you wanting just one more.

gltKCwT7UODZ5qE5c5sziw.text: This was an unfortunate experience for something that we had high hopes for.  My family and I were evaluating this location for a rehearsal dinner event and had notified one of the managers that we would be coming in.  After waiting around for a while we were told that there were no tables big enough for our group of 7 and that we would have to wait for some tables to clear out.  After an hour and 15 minutes we inquired again about a table and were told that there are only booths that would not be large enough for our party.  We inspected for ourselves and discovered that the booths were plenty big and we could have likely been seated at least a half hour earlier.   While one of the managers did start our night off with a complimentary plate of pimento cheese, this nice gesture was soon overshadowed by an impatient waitress.  As we were ordering the waitress was bold enough to tell a member of our party that "if she did not hurry up her order she would have to leave for another table."   Hoping that the food would make the wait worthwhile we were largely disappointed.  The green tomatoes and pork belly were both bland as was the shaved beef sandwich.  The best dish we were served was the short rib and that was still overly salty and does not stack up to other barbecue options available in Charlotte.   Overall this was a very poor experience and if you are looking for a brewery experience with some good food, don't waste your time on Suffolk Punch.

bv3kbQ7k0W_GMgMqXECYcA.text: I was in Charlotte a lot for work throughout 2017, and almost every trip I'd make a visit to the Suffolk Punch. Initially I went there for dinner, and was really impressed with their extensive beer list. The food was always good quality, fresh, and changed often to include seasonal ingredients. After a while I discovered they also serve coffee here during the day, and the baristas were all great and very friendly. Service was a bit varied - a couple of times I felt a bit neglected and had to wait quite a while to order or get my bill, but most of my visits I was looked after by one of the regular staff who would take excellent care of me, I was impressed by how knowledgeable they were about the beers, and they'd do nice things like recommend other cool places to check out in Charlotte.

PvpuOKDl4wKZwzGjmXwEkQ.text: FINALLY got to get in here and try this place after almost a year of having it in my bookmarks... pardon me - collection.  Decided to try a weekday night, since weekends seem to always be packed.  Was able to grab a booth and Tuesdays is half price off bottles of wine.  Ended up getting a Pinot Noir which was excellent.  Our server, Ashley, was really nice.  I got there much earlier than my friend, but she still came over and made sure I was taken care of - also made sure to pour my friend's glass so the wine could breathe.  It's all about the details.  We ordered the korean rock shrimp, pimento cheese/chips, and the pork belly and shared all the plates.  Everything was delicious and we even "went all out" and got the seasonal cheesecake that had a pumpkin chutney on top of it.  I ended up getting a double IPA (21 Hands) and it was decent... I was surprised to see a lot of variety in the Hyde beers for being a young brewery.  Overall a great dining experience.  The dining room is dim and relaxed, I'm sure it's a different story when there are a lot of people in here.  Their outdoor space (now with a winter tent and heaters) is a great space since it backs up to the light rail trail and New Bern Lynx Station.  I do agree with some of the previous reviews where parking is left to be desired, but with a light rail option, super walkable for Southend residents, this place is sure to stick around for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese and chips
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean Rock Shrimp

fnPZ47XA5jHEm1NnOn2ssA.text: If I could, I'd give them a 3.5!   Atmosphere: 5/5 - love the patio and that it's covered/heated in the colder months. It's dog and kid friendly. Seat yourself on the patio!  Location: 4/5 - right off the New Bern light rail. There's usually scooters parked outside too! Close to Triple C and Lenny Boy if you're looking to brewery hop.  Food: 4/5 - I've had a couple sandwiches before including the breakfast egg and sausage biscuit. Reasonable price point at brunch around $10-15 without a drink.  Beer: 3/5 - personally I'm not a huge fan but they do offer a wide selection.  Service: very spotty. Most recent experience, 2/5. Went on a Saturday around 11:45 am. Ordered outside right when we got there. It was busy so I was anticipating a wait for food. I received my food about 30 mins after ordering (reasonable based on the crowd). However, my friend didn't receive hers for an hour after I did. She went up several times to ask about her food and they kept saying the kitchen is backed up. I understand things happen but 1.5 hours to wait was slightly ridiculous. Luckily, the manager was very kind and offered her a gift card for the trouble.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg and cheese biscuit with sausage

iQWaVeF9JcOHOM14olw9Aw.text: Had brunch here a couple of days ago with some friends. The wait times were not awful, should of made a reservation but that's my fault! Don't know what I was expecting for a Saturday morning...   I always love a place with great food and gluten free options. This place was so cute and fun. The only downside I think were the wait times between ordering and getting our food. We ordered apps first and they had arrived 45 minutes later, and then when we ordered entrees we would not receive them for another hour, but there yummy food made up for all that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

btj_I2UkxgDQGYRpATV-Ng.text: Once again,  I arranged a group for the Suffolk Punch and this time their were mixed reviews on the cocktails but the Manhattan was well received.  I loved my cold brew with almond milk and the pineapple Kombucha... the buffalo shrimp are delicious and you can't go wrong with the burger.  Overall a easy breezy place to grab a drink, beer and enjoy a nice meal with quality ingredients. The server was super sweet and accommodating.  I was a little disappointed upon entering restaurant to find a little miscommunication between teammate I spoke with over phone and hostess stand.  Overall it was fixed by server but the manager or team lead never addressed which was surprising.

YAMIV6be7ewjZ-x0n3tJPA.text: Was surprised with the quality of food at this brewery. Was expecting "bar" food, but it was actually legit. The biscuits and gravy, pork belly appetizer, spinach artichoke dip, and burger were all really good. The ambiance of the place is also really nice. This is close to triple c and several other breweries if you want to hop around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes

BavzQwUbaqMP_EOzstdNrw.text: Came here with a group of 5 and we comfortably fit in the booths inside. I loved the decor and ambience of the place. The service was good, though I did have to ask for a refill on water. The food was okay, but definitely not worth the price. I got the breakfast burrito and it wasn't anything special. They didn't have soy milk, only oat milk. I was a little disappointed because we were mainly there for Sunday brunch and it didn't hold up to my expectations. I might give it another go and come back here just for drinks and small plates. But I definitely won't come for their mains.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast burrito

DntoHdwTA953qgGiRvdgOg.text: I've been here a couple of times for after work happy hours and it's a pretty good spot. They have lots of seating both inside and outside. They've also got an outside bar so you don't have to go back and forth should you chose to eat outside. They've got all kinds of incredibly good deals and the one I got to enjoy in this last visit was $3 in house beers. They have a very wide selection of Suffolk Punch beers so that gives you plenty to choose from and for a great price. Both times that I've had food here as well it's been pretty good. They give very good shareable sized portions and the quality of the food is great. This last time we got to try the chorizo nachos and all the toppings on it make it pretty filling but it's not too much where you'll feel way too stuffed afterward. We also got the frenched wings that have a really tasty sweet sauce and they're so tiny it's easy to eat a lot of em before you know it! And overall our drinks were good and well worth it. Definitely would come back here for another laid back afternoon.

Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Rose&#34;-berry mule
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo nachos

jhe5RxLS2i5WAt8VV_cG5Q.text: Great place! We only went for beverages so I can't speak for the food, but the facility, staff, and beer/cider are all awesome. The outdoor space is huge and there's multiple bar areas so we hardly had to wait in line on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  Bathrooms were clean with plenty of stalls. Live music was a nice touch for the afternoon. Overall a great day and look forward to coming back!

Lag7-tVDwI_XEuKhRha4ew.text: I've seen TSP all over my Instagram for some time now, especially for Sunday brunch. Now that I've moved to the area, I thought it would be a good place to check out with a friend visiting from out of town.   We went around 11:30 on a Sunday and were told there was a 30 min wait. No biggie. We sat at a couch by the coffee bar and got coffee and were seated in about 20ish minutes.   Here's my breakdown:  Coffee Bar: 10/10. I got an iced vanilla latte with oat milk and it was great. The coffee bar area is also just really cute.   Food: 5.5/10. The brunch menu was very limited. I got the chicken and biscuit. My food was served lukewarm like it had been ready for maybe 15 minutes but didn't make it to me at that point. It was okay I guess. Maybe my expectations were just too big. My friend got the same thing plus grits and both his food items were the same temp.   Service: 5/10. Our waitress didn't pay a lot of attention to us. Took her about 20 minutes to bring my friend an unsweet tea. Didn't really check on us.   Location: 10/10. It's on the rail trail and is within walking distance of lots of other cool Charlotte spots. Just be aware that parking is a battle in that area.   Ambience: 10/10. Love the decor and the music they were playing and the overall feel.   Ultimately, the service and food just didn't deliver based on my expectations. It's a place I would maybe go if it was picked by a group of friends, but I wouldn't pick it myself.

kPfaSScnnLSlg1P8HA_B0w.text: My boyfriend and i went on a Sunday expecting to have a nice brunch. The place was packed inside and outside, we waited for 40 minutes to get a table inside. This is not the place to have a nice big brunch. The food was pricey compared to the amount of food we got. I understand the food here is supposed to be  healthy but it wasn't even tasty. I had a cappuccino to go along with my meal; it was okay. My boyfriend had a coffee; It tasted like a cheap coffee brand and he couldn't even drink it . The waitress was nice. The decoration inside is nice, but we're not going back to this place.

lQX6pTNXail56mFTzWZ6CA.text: Stopped by here for brunch recently and had an ok experience. Parking in the area can be kind of iffy but they do have a small lot available so get there early or take the train. Upon enter, I really love the look and the vibe of the place with lots of greenery. They weren't busy so we were able to be seated immediately. The service was good since we sat on the inside instead of doing the outside self serve.   They have some interning cocktails, coffee, and mixes between the two but I didn't try any this time around. We ordered the chicken n biscuit and the breakfast burrito. Now aesthetically, the chicken biscuit was great. It's literally huge! Unfortunately, it really didn't have much flavor which was a bit disappointing. The breakfast burrito also could have used a hit of more seasoning. They weren't terrible, it's just for a $14 biscuit I expect it to be great. All in all an average experience.

cwr6pSCnz-9luFyESM6Cbg.text: Decent brunch nothing crazy tho. Came here for a get-together. We were a group of 16 (including two tots). We probably wouldn't have got inside anyways but we were told the outside area was the best bet. We managed to fit about 13 of us at one of the large tables but it was a little awkward.  We had the following: some mimosas, the chicken biscuit, hash brown casserole, and the apple cider bacon. Oh and half of a grapefruit elderflower spritz which was really yum. None of the food wowed me but none of it was bad either. Of the three food items the hash brown thing was the best.   The last sort of annoying thing was they messed up the bill. We had kept a tab open and when the hubby closed it they forget to add the food and when he pointed it out the guy was like whatever basically, then later came back with the full bill and reran our card. I never did get confirmation they cancelled the first charge soooo yea.  Also parking was extremely annoying but I guess it's kinda nice that the lightrail is right there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Far to close: bacon, chicken biscuit and hash brown casserole

oF38KnRprQx7LZlMNg9mjQ.text: Brunch Visit!  A very cool, hipster open space with a southern style menu. Love the housemade options for drinks too.  My Favorite items - Chicken & Biscuits, Chilaquiles  (my Moms are better, but they were really good) and the Pecan French Toast was decadent.   I loved the Warm Spices Latte, like a really nice Chai Tea Latte.  It is also on the light rail tracks, so afterward we grabbed some bikes from Spin and rode along the rail for a long way to work off that yummy southern food.  Only criticism was that the food was not super hot. I think they need to work on getting it to the table faster.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Biscuits, Pecan French Toast, Chilaquiles
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

ojRoLcKCdm8Wup7xLwdZCg.text: Well, the only reason we even stayed and ate here was because everyone in our party was starving. We sat on the patio. You have to order your food from the little bar area they have set up outside which was okay with us. The one thing that I hated and made me feel uncomfortable was the young lady who helped us. She made it seem like our presence was bothering her. She did not even try to hold a conversation with us like she did with the previous customers  before us. While we ordered she seem bothered  and she was definitely rude. The food was okay the chicken sandwich had some tasty bacon on it. The chicken biscuit was okay also. I just can't get over the fact of how poor the service was. I can't even begin to explain how I felt, I hope no one has to ever feel unwelcome & uncomfortable because that's how I felt. I feel no need to ever go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken biscuit
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken sandwich

zwUuRXrjlGx1jcqWjKttaw.text: I will give them this, they have a cool location. Also, their website is very inviting, hence me coming in for coffee and breakfast this morning. Two stars for the aforementioned location, satisfactory service and dirty chai. However, I came for coffee AND food. Here is a tip, don't advertise breakfast in your "culinary cafe" and put out a breakfast menu if you don't serve breakfast. When I asked about the food menu this morning, the answer was, "we aren't very busy for breakfast so we we don't have one". She then said we may have a small quiche with greens, but when she checked, you did not.

7L10pjt3rfPReM2LijB84A.text: And I thought service in Miami, FL was the worst I had ever had. I stand corrected...  While visiting NC, my good friend decided to check out this place that she had heard nothing but good things about. Needless to say I was excited because I rarely get to have brunch.  We arrived and it had started to rain so we ran inside. My friend had put us on the waitlist through the app and when we arrived were told it would still be about 15-20 minutes. In my book, this was a good sign considering how packed the place was. We asked if it was possible to sit at the bar and the hostess said of course and the brunch menu would be available there as well.   We sat down and waited for a little over 10 minutes before we were acknowledged by the two bartenders working that section of the bar, and by that I mean the one with the evil mustache completely ignored us and the other bartender greeted us only because he asked the people next to us if they were ok. We decided to let it slide because they were slammed.  We got our menus and ordered my friend ordered instantly cause she was ravenous (she ordered the shrimp and grits). I on the other hand wasn't ready and just ordered a biscuits and gravy to hold me off till I was ready to order, we also ordered our drinks at the same time. The drinks came out quick and I gave my order right then and there so my food would arrive a little after my friends.  The biscuits and gravy ended up coming out at the same time as the shrimp and grits about 10 minutes later. We didn't mind and started to eat instantly, well at least we attempted to when we discovered we had no silverware. No biggie, except we again struggled to get someone's attention. We finally got his attention, again, while he took care of the people next to us. This was the last time we saw the bartender, and by this I mean we can clearly see him working along with his partner, who again, hasn't even looked our way, but no service was provided after that, to us at least. They literally served everyone around us.  Did I mention that my food didn't show up for over 40 minutes? I had ordered huevos rancheros. At first, just cause of my background, I let it go... but after describing what I went through ^^^ you can see why I started to get mad. My friend thought he forgot, and I thought he just didn't put it in because he didn't care based on the service we were receiving. At this point, it was time to close out our tab for the items we had received and get out of this place. It took a while to get someone's attention again but my friend got as mad as I was and went directly to the hostess and requested a manager.  When she got back, FINALLY, after giving up hope, received my food. Except, the food looked like dog food, and it was ice cold. I don't mean that in an exaggerated manner either, it was literally cold, almost like it was sitting in the walk in. The manager came by minutes later and we explained what was going on. He apologized profusely and for obvious reasons comp'd my meal along with the biscuits and gravy. Much appreciated but the damage had been done already.   The manager dropped the tab but didn't charge us for the meal, leaving it to us to again, to get someone's attention to charge us which took another ten minutes or so before getting a female bartenders attention who seemed annoyed at the fact that she had to take care of us considering she was on the complete opposite end.  I have nothing else to add.... this was terrible...

GrJecLPdQrI2rrHfExSVDA.text: One of my favorite spots in southend. The variety of drinks and quality of food here is perfect. There is always a lively crowd but a chill vibe and atmosphere.

tvd95PvnQWELZ3247MINrA.text: Really happy we tried this place out.  Trendy spot - we sat outside on a warm afternoon, and the ambiance was very cool.  Huge beer selection, including quite a few sour beers which I enjoyed.  Food was also really good - we had the perogies as an appetizer (very good).  I had the burger which was also quite tasty and my husband had the chicken sandwich which he also liked!  Minus one star for the service - it took a long time for food to come out (and several times the incorrect food was brought to our table).  Also took a really long time to get our tab paid for at the bar.  I don't mind ordering and paying for the bill at the bar, as long as their staffed for it...which they didn't appear to.    Will definitely be back for the cool vibe, great drinks, and tasty food :)

QtPHNVW6WiZ6QVzhdSOGQw.text: I've visited here several times and finally decided to review after another disappointing visit. I love the outdoor space and drink selections, and have always received great service from the outdoor bartenders. However, nearly every time I've visited, I've had awful service from their rude staff whether it be a hostess or a food runner. I'm not sure what goes on, but no one seems happy and seems put-out to help the customer. Yesterday was the first time I tried brunch (sat outside where there is a limited brunch menu, different from the inside offering) and I was pretty disappointed. My egg sandwich was mediocre and certainly didn't match the price. I'm not sure I'll go back after another bad visit, despite the awesome location right on the rail trail.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch: egg muffin, fruit, mimosa

MVmvaYm_dN35R0xBpPUVJw.text: Two visits confirmed this as a South End staple, both for food and drinks. Glad to see the expanded portfolio from Hyde Brewing fully in place and was nice to have lunch here on a random Friday without I being too crowded. Liked an IPA I had and my friend enjoyed the porter.   Similar to Sycamore, this is a "see and be seen" spot for the neighborhood, but I particularly like the use of greenery with the lofty ceilings, also seen at Divine Barrel Brewing over in NoDa. Plenty of seating options to choose from, both inside and out, and the location right on the Rail Trail makes it an ideal location for urbanites or those visiting town making use of the Blue Line. That is also a subtle way of saying parking is limited.   My first trip I was very pleased with the veggie burger, certainly one of the best versions I've had around town. Second time I went the opposite direction and enjoyed the uniquely styled wings; don't worry, there really isn't any spice and they were not messy to eat, so user friendly.   Good service AND they leave a glass carafe of water on the table, always gets points in my book. Suffolk Punch is a place helping Charlotte definite itself and continues ie to develop a distinct personality. I'll most certainly be back and easily ranks as one of my favorites in South End.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unique wings
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie burger and side salad

tHynXhqfQvF0ZXWFiEKz1g.text: After driving around two times, we got lucky and found a parking spot in front of the restaurant.  The restaurant is really nice and the outdoor area looks great.  Our waitress was nice.  Our food (argentine steak and fish and chips) was served cold.  I didn't think much of it but then I heard the people behind us complain about the same thing.  Food was not great either.  The beer was at least good.  I'd come back but only for the beer or maybe brunch since that looks better in the pictures. But hey try it for yourself.

dkiZjvR1y0_91wB1RnrG7w.text: Great restaurant awesome selection of beers and ciders. The pork belly and steak was delicious I don't care for grits but they did it quite well. Manager was very friendly as was staff. Must try, we had 5 different type of small plates they were all delicious. Keep it up guy !

bnCk6lpDGzl2zK6icjamLg.text: Ok, so what's all the buzz about Suffolk Punch?!  We decided to go there, multiples times, to find out.  Our first trip was with a few friends to chat about life in general.  We had no trouble finding a booth by the window to enjoy each other's company.  The food was great!  Being a vegetarian, I ordered the veggie burger and was not disappointed.  However, I requested blue cheese crumbles because I don't like goat cheese.  I was quickly informed they do not carry blue cheese (GASP).  It's like a staple of every kitchen serving burgers.  What!!?   I assumed my overreaction would cause them to reconsider adding the item on their menu.  Coming back a second time, we had burgers (mine being veggie again) and like the first time it was super delish.  I think they must put crack in their fries because I can't stop eating them.  Welp, still no blue cheese.  Grrrrrr.   Ok, so surely a third visit would do the trick.  Nope.  I came back with a large group of friends this time.  Still no dang blue cheese.  I'm going to have to BYOBC (bring your own blue cheese) next time.  So frustrating.  Anyway, my only critique beyond the blue cheese is that they only give you tiny cups with ketchup in them.  You have to order tons of cups to get enough ketchup for your fries.  Their Bloody Mary is good (not great... it could be spicier).  They plenty of seating and lots of great outdoor space.  I highly recommend coming here to hang out and eat.  However, be warned that they don't have blue cheese.   Hahaha.  Enjoy!

_iK_m0sX25l6UkW-GctilQ.text: An amazing experience! I would highly recommend and will definitely be back. We had the pimento cheese appetizer-the bacon jam was to die for. I also had the arugula beet salad. The mix of flavors in these dishes was fantastic. Will definitely be back for dinner soon to try out the craft beers on tap as well. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the decor is perfect for the location. It helps to smell the amazing Hyde's Brewing coffee as well!!

0n6mcGRD9LPOlSTZmpK_FQ.text: I really wanted to like this place. However, overpriced food and small portions with slow service means I won't be back. Add to that fact a health rating of 96.5 with two dogs (clearly not service animals) allowed in the dining area, being petted by staff leaves room for doubt about the overall cleanliness and hygiene of the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

Y8So6LKkF5r70T-z0R5fMA.text: We had the pleasure of strolling into this place because we had some time to kill before heading back to Dallas.  As service industry veterans, my husband and I were completely impressed with everything!  Great food, great environment, and even better staff (shout out to Walker and Mike for the hospitality).  We will def be back when in NC!

JROVDJwDIEP5446_dUSxYQ.text: Love love love the brunch here! First time today trying it & we will definitely be back. I'm from CA so I don't love fried foods but the chicken & biscuit was amazing! Lightly fried & a side of fruit to balance it out

olDxO1dbEHM_AxkvVNaCoQ.text: Came in for a late night dinner! We felt terrible ordering so close to 11 but Olivia assured it was fine! Michael and Walker were awesome and full of helpful beer knowledge to get us paired with the right one! Definitely coming back!

iQks8swK8ZDLizNX2M4C0Q.text: Probably one of my favorite outdoor beer gardens in south end. Always a super fun young crowd, awesome for weeknights or a nice Saturday. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is that I think they need to have better food options.

N1pCp_UcDg4Gry4QNQRXWA.text: A great environmental with both a beautiful interior and exterior! We brought our Pup here and we loved that we were able to enjoy some goods bears and food while our dog got to lay by us and see other pups! This is such an awesome restaurant in a cool area. Right by the light rail and trail, we are able to either take the rail or walk our dog down the trail while enjoying the restaurant! Would definitely recommend to anyone new or living in the Southend area. We will definitely be back and cannot wait until it is warmer and can hang outside more with our pup!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

GkiYEX-Wy3CnCVI3h8AKPg.text: Really nice interior decor...That's all I can really say.   The food was average at best and the service (albeit I've only been once) was pretty awful! The waitress admitted to not knowing the menu very well and would forget to find out the answers to our food/drink questions and then would also forget to return to ask what we would like to order. One drink was clearly wrong and the waitress made up a story about how this was a new drink. Coffee with milk was ordered, tea with milk was given (with a tea bag)...and we were told the tea leaves in the bag were coffee...   Perhaps others will have better experiences here, we just will not be returning.

nRgML9lZWV7pEoPjrvWTSA.text: The little baby wings are like little puppy's. Guilty pleasures but you're allowed to eat these

jdyBJcqFKjfYfRRethqILg.text: After an off day for brunch, the owner kindly contacted me and invited us to give them another try. We did so this past Sunday and were pleasantly surprised! We sat outside and ordered at the bar. My food literally came immediately and the place was crowded! It was fresh, tasty, and we will certainly be back!

1OHE4JIbvXOYOqxwqNBpug.text: Love this place! Their beer list is extensive and their prices are great. You can have a meal of small plates or a full size meal to yourself. The atmosphere is my favorite part, it is a large open space that can accommodate the masses on any given day. I was in tonight for a quick dinner and everyone was watching baseball and football at the bar, celebrating a birthday on the patio, and having casual dinner with family and friends. The food was very tasty. They have a few fresh dishes, but overall definitely a heavier fall style menu right now. We had the deviled eggs, charcuterie board, sauteed mushrooms, and a fried goat cheese salad.  Follow me @jodieats_

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

i1T1EyTCBhc_b0QKAlyHhQ.text: After spending a week in Charlotte for work, I needed a beer (or 4). The Suffolk Punch mixed two of the best things on the planet: quality food and craft beer. The outdoor seating is hip and plentiful; long wooden tables and benches sit under a hanging of string lights. The tables have their own collections of succulents, and the benches give a community vibe. I ordered the Suffolk Punch burger and a flight of five beers. The burger came with a pretzel bun, bourbon mustard, gruyere, and pickles. Word to the wise: I ordered it medium rare and it was pretty close to rare, so order a bit warmer than you normally would. The burger was a little messy, and I've learned I don't like pretzel buns, but a solid burger. Friends got the shaved wagyu sandwich (with gruyere, jus, and horseradish cream) and couldn't say enough good things. If you want to sit outside, you'll only have access to a limited menu, but the inside is beautiful and inviting. I grabbed a five-beer flight, and for $15, I was blown away. The samples were probably 6 oz, and I couldn't finish all five. Definitely a great bang for your buck if you want to try multiple beers. Overall awesome experience!

SUPRs6-2UVwTNQv-pAxq9g.text: Great ambience, innovative menu, and coffee cocktail is a  refreshing scenery.  We stumbled upon its first days serving brunch menu, and it does not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buckwheat pancake and quail

g9tUCDKVK8j-FUX8Kup9tQ.text: Excellent food and beer. We've been back multiple times! Service is great, and one of the coolest atmospheres with excellent decor. You won't be disappointed!

q3PrtdgLdtU1PCHW9SqTJQ.text: My fiance and I have had brunch here previously but this was our first time having dinner. This is a good place to go to if you enjoy small plates. Everything we had was good, but the menu was limited. The Argentine Steak was my favorite of the small plates that we ordered. The steak was cooked perfectly and the chimichurri sauce was a great compliment. We also ordered the Pork Belly, Seared Tuna, Crab Croquettes and Wagyu Carpaccio. They were all good but not great. I would suggest going here for brunch over dinner.
