Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

G8DV_bzhdasSKuvtdgWX3g.text: I enjoyed my latte at the Suffolk Punch...great atmosphere while working on my laptop..  I will definitely come back and will try out the menu next time... the food looks great!

AvI9qi0JMMM3OP-qY4gCmw.text: If you are looking to go to a pub like environment, this is a fine place.  In other words, have a beer (good selection) but the cocktails are average and the food selection is limited and mostly average.  The wait times for a table are just horrible and hopefully you will land some free seating, if you are lucky.

YNuUuxlfposMjW3AF-5lUg.text: Fabulous atmosphere! We attended a special event at Suffolk Punch Norfolk hall and enjoyed a wonderful dinner. The hall is a spacious warehouse but had great decorations and layout with spaces for dancing, the bar in the middle and the tables in the back. Dinner was family style and the bbq meats were delicious, beef spare ribs, chicken and pork. They had sides of vegetables and mac & cheese. The appetizers were shrimp po boy mini sandwiches and pork wonton dumplings and some sort of quiches. My hubs liked their IPA beer and I enjoyed the Pinot Grigio wine. I really liked the design of the space and the layout.  Parking is crazy because of the neighborhood but be prepared to walk to the venue.

xxtThfZ7pn4Q3dzhfy8Xog.text: I have frequented Suffolk on many occasions, specifically to have a pint of beer. Recently had dinner and wanted to try brunch. My dinner was very good, however, brunch was extremely disappointing :-(  the menu is simple and very appealing but the food lacked flavor and seasoning.   Food: I ordered the crab cake Benedict on an open English muffin was sooooo dry. There was barely any hollandaise sauce which in my opinion is the best part. The egg was almost cooked through. Everything about it lacked excitement or flavor to be remembered. My two other brunch companions had the Steak and eggs. The eggs were super runny, one of them had their steak brought very well done, the other was medium, both of them seemed very disappointed as well. The roasted potatoes were good (I ordered them on the side). The beer was the best part of my meal quite honestly!   Ambiance: We sat on the patio on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon. No humidity and the fans felt perfect. It truly is very pretty and pleasant to sit outside but the down side is if you want to eat you have to order at the bar and it's brought to you. There isn't full service. The bar servers are very nice and are eager to help. All that said, I would return for drinks and perhaps dinner. While weather permits I love the patio but suggest getting a table inside if you choose to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

gAyHTRU2cX1xcdAEubFK7w.text: Suffolk is one of the most beautifully designed locations in SouthEnd. I love walking in to the atmosphere it creates. The outdoor space is a great vibe as well where many restaurants miss the mark.   When coming to Suffolk Punch, try the in house Hyde beer. There are so many great ones so if you're not familiar, at least ask for a sampling before going to your normal.   Also, I'm going to request this publicly to bring back The Mildenhall Treasure! Who doesn't love a great champagne drink but for me, I loved the name. My son was born in England while stationed in RAF Mildenhall so the name made the drink that much more delicious! I hate to see it's gone.   TIP: If you can use Uber/Lyft or the light rail, do it. The parking is limited. I'm coming from the Lake Norman area so we always have to pray for parking when coming to SouthEnd.

n8ihj3pcsgOt_nMPK5KV7Q.text: Cool place to hang out and catch up with friends!  But the small appetizers are a little pricey. Paid $7 for fries. It was smaller than a McDonald's large lmao   Still enjoyed this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. IPA!

P-l7BidBYFhmPC4FnpSkXw.text: Brunch is my favorite meal of the day and this place had excellent reviews, a nice selection of brunch items and a killer drink menu so it was a top choice.   Sunday around 1:30 the place was packed inside and on the patio, there was a band playing good music and the vibe was positive. There was a 45 minute wait for an inside table, bar was full. Tip- you can check your place in line through a link that they send you via text.   Two seats opened at the bar so we ordered  drinks or at least tried to, bartenders looked like they were changing shifts or trying to decide who to serve next. After about 10 minutes we were acknowledged and received a menu by a very nice lady. I ordered a bloody mary extra spicy, it was good but not spicy.   Once we went to our table to eat we were very excited that we still made it in time for brunch, it was 2:15. Our server was very pleasant, great personality and very honest when asked a question about a meal.   I placed an order for Crab Cake Benedict $16 and a side of roasted potatoes $4. Benedict's are usually my go to brunch meal and I was definitely looking forward to trying these since the crab cakes were house made. Once I placed my order, the waiter asked me if I was ok with poached eggs, I thought that was strange but didn't think too much of it.   Order arrives and it's a beautiful presentation and looks perfect. After my second bite I realized something was totally wrong, I was eating an egg that was close to being hard boiled and definitely not poached. It made the meal kinda dry and it was just ok. Crab cakes were absolutely delicious and seasoned well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch time!
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict $16
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drink menu

Q7TJJYrCRvOp0NUaSztUzw.text: Very great location!! Right off the New Bern lynx stop. Came in with a group of friends around 7p and was greeted by the hostess and immediately taken to our table. Not too busy on a Wednesday night but a good crowd inside and outside in the patio where there is also a bar to serve patrons. The appetizers were served fresh and hot and even the entree (i had the NC Trout) was delicious. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area

sA-J-aXUv0lEmcoSuj59cQ.text: Out and about on the hottest of days having a go at southern living we got into the Suffolk Punch a little after 8:00am and had the place pretty much to ourselves while freshening up. Asked for and received the flattest and whitest of coffees... put a hat on mine while finishing up the work thing and by the time I got back to it some of the micro-bubbleage decayed into standard bubbles :-( Coffee was still plenty hot and delicious from top to bottom; silky smooth and well balanced throughout. yea mouth feel!! As we were going about our business clusters and intrepid solo travelers wandered through, mostly getting their morning beverages and going their merry ways, a few lingered in spacious hall working in the strong morning light. Plenty of room to spread out at hi- and normal tops and a bar and all of outside so go ahead and bring everyone you know.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. thank you Madison :-)
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. way too early for anything but coffee

RqCBIiqS-_nCQDVzJNZPOg.text: Great spot for breakfast/morning meetingd. Came here for meet up for a professional organization and really enjoyed it. The space is beautiful and the coffee is good.   They offer oat milk, which the barista told me is more expensive so not many places offer it, so I tried it in a vanilla latte and LOVED it. The oat milk gave the latte more body.  The assorted pastries were not in public display, but the barista opened a Tupperware container to show me some muffin options.   There was parking, it was quiet and coffee- what more do you need for a morning meeting spot?

xOH4Ft5srRUHZE4O_RDPDw.text: We finally made it! A couple of years of reading yelp reviews and we finally made it. Our bartender Anthony was very cool, he hooked my wife up with extra lavender in her "purple haze" drink. She loved it.  The beer I had I thought was amazing. It was called "don't tempt me with a good time.  Another employee that was very nice was Rachel. she deserves kudos as well and Anthony. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Purple Haze
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance

ne19uMkuOX7-nuu1y7vQFw.text: I like this bar/brewery spot. The fact that they have cocktails and a brewery and food is impressive to me . I can attest to the fact that the cocktails on draft and the food are good.  This visit I had Some Like It Tart cocktail and it did not disappoint. I also enjoyed then veggie burger with the goat cheese crema on the side , and fries . I wouldn't come here to eat , only because it's so crowded, truly a loud , hangout spot, BUT if it was just a restaurant, that happened to serve drinks I would definitely go.   The music is/was good . The patio is large , with its own bar. Bench seating in turf, and canopy to keep the sun from baking you . Lots of people with dogs, if you lik to bring your dog too. It backs right up to the rail trail, if you choose to park further away and ride or walk via the rail trail .

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie burger with goat cheese crema on the side

CwTaDFLlKK0TS9OLnHCFZA.text: Suffolk Punch is a regular "go to" for us! They do so many things well that we keep coming back for more. It is a beautiful place inside and out and very well kept. The food has been pretty good every visit.  We have enjoyed the burgers and the sauteed NC shrimp as an appetizer. The beer has gotten better & better over the time they have been open. Our favorite is the Suffolk Punch- Don't Threaten Me with a Good Time IPA. On Thursdays and Sundays there are $3 Suffolk Punch beers which doesn't get better than that! There is plenty of inside and outside seating with a bar, TVs, and games outside too. Stay tuned to their social media pages for events and live music!   The only reason why I am giving 4 stars is because the staff can be "stand-offish" for lack of a better term. There have been numerous occasions when we have visited the bar attempting to buy a drink when the bartenders have basically ignored or have been disinterested in serving us. We visited at different times of the day and night and it is all the same. Hopefully this will change in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sautéed NC Shrimp

JBFhSo4RAqWZXX6Jwx_cWw.text: I really like this place. It's right off the New Bern light rail stop or there is street parking available. The decor is super cute with lots of plants hanging from the ceiling. There is a huge outdoor space to enjoy nice weather days.   The food is pretty good but can be overly salty. I've tried the Rueben, the mussels, the steak sandwich, and a few other things I don't remember.   The one thing I dislike is how far the bathrooms are from the main seating area.

M38z8cPeh6y2buXouShNyQ.text: Notable: what an awesome location and atmosphere. It's a coffee shop and breakfast meets a brewery and delicious hipster style restaurant.   This review speaks to two different times I visited within a one week.   Visit #1 - Showed up shortly after arriving in North Carolina. My buddy has a soy allergy which means that he cannot eat out many places. Suffolk Punch, however, has a menu full of soy free options.   If soy is somehow the delicious ingredient everyone uses to make their food taste better, this place knows how to make the food to taste great without it.   Visit #2 - My buddy works within walking distance of this place. As a result, while he worked one day, I wandered over here at about 9 in the morning.   The espresso was on point and they had plenty of seating where one could work, read, or chat with your people.   There was an interesting vibe. It seemed to be half young professionals working on their home businesses and business executive types, in suits, meeting with clients/coworkers.   The beer is excellent. They must have at least 40 choices and they have something for everyone. Plus they do daily deals for the food or drinks. On Thursday, it's half price on all Suffolk Punch beers. That makes each craft beer about 3 bucks.   Can't wait to be in town again to visit this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. The whole seating area!
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee bar!
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

TlRvdVPSBsiE6Xv8pjMQBA.text: Went here for brunch on a Saturday around 11:30. Didn't have any type of wait.  I loved the decor and atmosphere. They a bar and indoor and outdoor seating. I opted for indoor. The outdoor seating it first come first serve and you order from their little outside food truck.   The brunch menu is not humongous. They have a few things that they perfect. About 10 adult options with a mix of salads, sandwiches, starters, and breakfast food.   I ended up getting the Chicken- N Biscuit which was fried chicken, scratch-made biscuit, scrambled eggs, and peppercorn chive gravy.   It was DELICIOUS! and a very large portion. The chicken was so fresh and fried perfectly they were stomped all over Chick-fil-a biscuits . Definitely recommend and I will be back and will enjoy the outdoor patio next time.   Only downside: Parking is very limited. Unless you live in South End and can walk there I suggest Ubering or even taking the train if you have access to that. I don't living closer to the Steele Creek area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken-N-Biscuit

Y2icqyh02bYOrEd2VIgnLA.text: This place was recommended by a coworker for brunch.  I went on a Saturday around 11:30.  My party was seated immediately.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  The chicken biscuit looked amazing but we ordered crab cake Benedict and steak and eggs.   The crab cake Benedict was delicious. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the crab cake was well seasoned. I was skeptical about the steak.  It looked dry but it was not.  No sauces needed for the steak.    There's an extensive drink menu.  A friend ordered a mimosa.  All champagne with a splash of orange juice. No one complaints about that.   I will go again for brunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict

t_wf0XoUVsA3yBnGsJ3pHA.text: The best part about this place is the spacious outdoor seating area. There are a bunch of cafeteria-style wooden benched tables with greenery in the middle which looked great and accommodated our huge party of 14 people. Unfortunately there weren't a lot of other strengths.  The food was just okay overall. I ordered the chicken biscuit with scrambled egg and gravy which looked better than it tasted. First of all there was not nearly enough gravy. And it was the unanimous decision of everyone at the table that the salt was sorely lacking. We also ordered a side of bacon which was decent and a side of hash brown casserole with pimento cheese which I must say was exceptional. Definitely the highlight of the meal.  I found the outdoor ordering process to be unnecessarily confusing and apparently the staff agrees, as there was a huge mixup with our bill. It eventually got worked out of course, but it was a headache I didn't really want to deal with on a lazy Sunday morning. The parking situation was also a nightmare. More negatives than positives IMHO.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hash Brown Casserole
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Biscuit
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon

akthtmpzw7UgO_O_Oh2Dyw.text: What a difference going here late in a Sunday afternoon makes! Seriously, night n day from my previous experience!!  Kudos to Management for reaching out after my previous experience. I felt heard and like they were genuinely shocked by my experience.  Today, it was a complete 180 from last time. It's hard to gauge because it was not nearly anywhere near as busy as last time.  I had a flt of beer, which I highly recommend. They do generous flt pours and you can pick any four from their full offerings. Also, on Thurs & Sundays they have $3 Suffolk Punch pints!   I also had their reuben, which I am a bit of a snob about. Theirs was definitely tasty, w/excellent meat to kraut to dressing ratio. Fries are def the recommended side for this dish as well.  Service was 1000% better this go round. Not only did I get my drink order taken right when I sat at the bar this time around, but my food order was taken and came out quickly! I wanted to have the espresso creme du pot on their dessert menu, but they weren't making it tonight. Instead I drank my dessert w/the tasty coffee cocktail "Whiskey Business".   All in all a completely different experience than my first, which I am more happy to share!

N2x26V5bO2EaVmpvXgKC5Q.text: Was here for lunch and boy did I ordered a lot of food. Can't help it..   Customer service: 3/5 she was ok.. It doesn't seem that busy but it's hard to track her down when need be.   Food: 5/5 The Korean wings. Yum.. nice and easy to eat. Have a crispy exterior. And you can eat with or without sauce..  The crispy shrimp was pretty good. I like it but not as much as I like the wings.  Their Pork Belly was very good. Whatever it was sitting on wasn't. Very soggy. Nooo likey   All in all, since I was on a lunch break. I was let able to try their beer selections but would love too. And will be back for it!

nwWMMWtREXfjm0VNCANyqA.text: Very good food and ambience.  Would definitely come back. The burgers (especially the veggie) are AMAZING! Great selection of beef as well. Outdoor space is very spacious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Celebrating this guy for Father&#39;s Day!

g462yPoWXd0sAvWRDoyCyg.text: I tried Suffolk Punch for the first time a few weekends ago. It was a pretty slow Saturday morning so we were seated quickly. My boyfriend & I both ordered the chicken & egg biscuit. It was huge! The chicken & gravy had so much flavor. It was amazing. I had drip coffee with seasonal fruits and my boyfriend had an iced cappuccino with chocolate/ cinnamon flavor. We both really enjoyed our meals. I would recommend Suffolk Punch for a good brunch

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wow!

ldnnNIbHFrPdDuWdApEiQw.text: I'm giving this places solid 4 stars because I love the vibe, coffee, beer selection and most of the food options!  It's definitely a millennial dream come True and hipster vibe. If that's you, give it a try! It has a brewery/Coffee/food vibe. Which is chill, relaxing and comforting.    During the day you can bring your laptop and get work done while enjoy a sip of delicious well crafted coffee, and even grab a beer if that's your style with a great menu to choose from.   From the menu I definitely recommend the veggie burger! Very delicious.  The reason I'm not giving it a 5 and taking away a star is because one time I came with a bunch of friends and we ordered a dessert, which had nuts in it (not listed on the menu). My friend took a bit and has a slight allergy to peanuts (slight meaning tickling/stinging sensation in the throat but not anaphylactic). When we stated that to the waiter, he was angry that she took the bit because he could have reused that dessert for someone else! Wait what? Someone else? Then proceed to tell us they only have a limited number of desserts because they are frozen.   It made me really sad that this event occurred because I had high hopes for this place.   I still enjoy the vibe and drinks. But definitely won't be getting any dessert anytime soon, and be double checking if there are nuts in anything, especially if you have an allergy!

uzgV2ubag6xN-DIOD2UI_w.text: I think the atmosphere is incredible here.  The decor and set up is perfect.  Attractive and competent wait staff and bartenders.  They were super busy, which is a great sign in my book. Well I really couldn't care less about the beer, even though that was good as well. It advertises as a restaurant so I am writing based in the actual food. I ordered a salad with field greens and roasted beets.  Its was pretty small for a salad and the beets were not roasted at all. Definitely came straight from a jar out of the fridge.  The taste of it was ok despite not being as advertised. I could see someone not liking it because the greens were very bitter.  Stronger than arugula.   I ordered some wagyu steak on the side and it came out pretty much raw-- rarer than rare.  And about 5 small squares or meat. I was never asked how I wanted it-- but none the less it was ok.  Not the best flavor.   It was not even hot.  They could have added some more pistachios and lettuce to the salad.   Maybe some extra lemon dressing.   But for the price they charge I would not eat here again.   Definitely not worth the high prices. But I will come back for the atmosphere and a drink.

18o2dbrUlOal54dFs423SQ.text: We checked in with the No Wait App and the wait was much shorter than estimated; always a positive! We started with the pimento cheese and bacon jam and it was delicious! My husband got the Suffolk Punch burger I think it was called and it came out perfectly cooked and tasty. I got the BLT which was good, nothing too crazy and out of the ordinary. We also enjoyed a few of their beers. They had 19 Hyde beers on tap which is way more than the 4 they had last time. Overall, definitely enjoyed it and will be back!

n_gBwsAFJhIjsdeWpT0y_w.text: Check out the new kid on the brewery block. This brewery is across the street from one of the best breweries in Charlotte, Triple C. The bad thing, parking is now terrible around here. I drove around a lot before finally deciding reluctantly to part in front of one of the buildings that didn't have a sign saying they would tow your car away. My suggestion, since this brewery is located right next to a light rail station, is park in the train lot and right the train here.  This place was absolutely packed when we arrived around 5 pm. I'm amazed that there are that many people available! given the number of breweries. I think because they have a great food option as well, it makes this place like a super brewery. They have a large outside area and a large inside area. I think they kick people out of the inside tables around 5 pm and it begins to be used exclusively for sit down table service. We got on a waiting list and it took about 45 minutes to get a table, fortunately, we got an outside table. Less noisy and the weather was really nice. They also have an outside tap area, so you can get a beer outside, and sit at the outside picnic tables and avoid the crowded inside area. They weren't brewing their own beer yet when we went there, so have to wait on that. They had lots of other local craft options and a full bar service.  This remains me a of a wicked weed style place. A little higher end business feel, with lots of beer and food options. Its not your typical brewery feel. Its good, and will always be packed I think because it offers so much, but it doesn't really have a brewery feel either. I'll be back, but might stop by the real brewery, Triple C first, first for a beer before crossing the street to get some good food!

2YFJqRVLIqmJLnZmJEw0Yw.text: Today we stopped in for brunch after a workout. Split a French toast and omelet with my friend. Best decision ever. Both were to die for.  Very prompt service and no wait at 11 am. Very cool environment and amazing staff.

E6tvDhfaVvVq9yA1FJzaqg.text: A great please to sit in the mornings and drink coffee and work, located next to the light rail. The menu has delicious breakfast offerings as well for those that are on the go. A must stop anytime of the day.

ydvxoHt12sLxc0ku3FLo_Q.text: Understandably, this place is new so it's PACKED on weekends. My friends and I went on a Friday night for dinner and drinks. We had a party of six and about an hour wait as they only serve food inside. The good news was, they have a huge patio to hang out on. Downside, you have to wait inside to get drinks before finding a seat outside. I'd recommend they add waiters/waitresses for drinks outside too especially with the long wait times for tables. Plus more tips for them right?  Anyway, we enjoyed a couple rounds trying a few of their different drafts - the selection is a little overwhelming because there are so many unique options. After about an hour, we were finally buzzed for our table (they text you btw. Or you can track progress via a link to Yelp after you put your name in).  I was a little disappointed at how small their menu is, but figured the burger as seen on other tables looked sufficient.   We started with the pickles which btw are not fried - we assumed they were. For $5 you get a small bowl of homemade slightly dill pickles. They were fresh and tasty at least and came out quick. Next, several of us (4 of 6) ordered the burger and fries, one friend got the bacon and tortillas and another got a salad and the potato croquets.   The burger was delicious as were the fries. The bacon was more like strips of fatty pork belly served with grilled tortillas (I'm so happy i didn't order it because I would have hated it). My friend said they were good enough.   Overall it was okay. I probably wouldn't be a frequent visitor for dinner due to long waits and small selection, but it'd be a great hangout spot to grab drinks and catch up with friends on the patio. Plus they have a killer location right at the light rail.

LuSeZ32zCzjVbFy8xwzZ6Q.text: First time trying out Suffolk Punch. They had an awesome beer selection and the Thursday special is a really good deal! $3 beers (doesn't include some of the sours or seasonals depending on the brewing process) and a huge list to choose from. The bartender was very nice and informative when I asked for any recommendations as to what beer I should get. Overall great service and a great atmosphere, will definitely be back!

WSUe2u9qYn-BVDZ6iqkBOA.text: Went last night, around 7.15. It was very lively, but we were able to get a very comfortable booth and the noise level wasn't so loud that we had to raise our voices to have a conversation. I'm finding this is becoming a problem in many establishments (or it's because I'm getting more life experience, aka older ;) )  Our server was very friendly and helpful in walking us through the menu and making some suggestions. We had 2 different beers both brewed by Hyde, I wish I remembered the names, both were delicious.   We shared the tuna, fried green tomatoes, and deviled eggs from the small plates, and the pickled grape salad, added shrimp. Everything we ate was outstanding!   Despite being a converted warehouse with industrial decor, the place felt warm and welcoming, probably thanks to the plants hanging from baskets throughout the restaurant and the warm colors used on leather booths. Kudos to the designer(s).

uxFPc0iUamqXcmG0W7EMXg.text: Great place generally speaking. Good selection of beer and decent bar food at a reasonable price. The reason I can't give it a 5 is because of the cheapness of the mixed drinks. I ordered a Bloody Mary from a female bartender and she barely put a splash of vodka in it. I thought maybe I had missed something so I said nothing. But after tasting it it was clear she made it really weak. I asked her to throw some more vodka in there but she gave me a nasty look and said shes not supposed to do that. I gave her a nasty look back and told her if she made it right in the first place i would not have to ask. She threw another splash of cheap well vodka in. It still tasted like mix only but I'm not looking for an argument so I walked. My advice to management is tell servers dont go cheap on the mixed drinks. I mean, what's your motive? Well alcohol is cheap anyway. Make the customers happy so they come back and give you more money.

EG3-n8iKg6e8OvS7ErqGCw.text: Yo fuck this place. I've come here a bunch of times for beers or coffee. I came here one night for late night. Said they served food until 11pm and then when we went to order a cheese plate at 10:45 they threw a huge hissy fit. If you're going to serve food until 11 serve it til 11.   The south end needs a place to grab drinks and food late night. This isn't it. Don't come here for that.

4sftehvBh4wZwRg7TF13fA.text: Checked out The Suffolk Punch on opening night with the wife and (1.5 year old) kid...  Great place! Awesome atmosphere, A+ service, fantastic large patio right on the rail trail, great beer selection even before their own brews are available. Food was also delicious, though my only complaint is that some of the portions were a little light for the price point; but hey, that's what you get for a place that's definitely a grade or two higher in class than most of the other brewery options around town.   We got a bit busy trying to keep the toddler busy as the food came out, so I only managed to snag a photo of the potato croquettes, all the food looked as great as it tasted though.   We will definitely be back to sample more of the selection and enjoy the patio sans-kids.   ...went back for coffee/breakfast and it was also fantastic. Loved the draft coffee "hoptail"

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nitro draft &#34;hoptail&#34;
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate cinnamon latte

gKV__uHyeJZyxDfGcNmUaw.text: Really fine food at breakfast and lunch with of course great coffee and beer. Very efficient and friendly service from Deon!   Huge space indoors and out near the light rail.  All good.

NW2hD0Vx7okLb31vmDlpzw.text: Original menu & tasty beers! Order a burger & it was cooked to perfection. Ambiance was amazing & service was efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

4j4ObKEoXgmbjgNzZBZAlw.text: Good not great.    The first beer that I got was pretty tasty.  The second, a double IPA, was disgusting and I left 90% of it.  I produced better home brew with my first few batches.    The mussels - Very good.  Lots of flavor.    The burger - absolutely forgettable.  Fried avocado and ceviche special - straight up bad.    Roasted veg side - excellent.  The veggies were cooked perfectly.    I may go back to Suffolk Punch at some point.  But I definitely am not in any rush.

OM9TXnPnphlCuYyaNRUq4A.text: Came for dinner and drinks - must say this place is great for both! A variety of standard but good small plates. The menu has a lot of classics but they are served with great presentation and great flavors. Got a flight of 5 beers of my choice which was great since the list is so long you want to try them all! They also have great cocktails. Atmosphere is fun - people stand at the bar inside and out, and they also have big tables for large parties and booths for smaller parties. High ceilings and really cool decor make for a cool place to hang out. Gets quieter around 9 or so but is definitely a great place for happy hour.

gqwHGYzRJs5EenQs2eiyjA.text: Great beer, food, drinks, and atmosphere! Clockwork Orange IPA is one of our favorite beers in Charlotte.

vMH_zp1OOYoPxA4n3DKv8Q.text: Extremely satisfied with returning here. My original experience wasn't great but second time definitely was.  Thank you to Seth for accommodating my friends and I last evening . It was much appreciated and we shall return again!

apvbBEy7JQItNUTTDZ8E6A.text: such a great atmosphere, staff, food, & drinks! Local fav, we hit this spot often! Brunch and dinner are both amazing!

_6DMoDdz_h4IaYsDexEZLw.text: Had to wait for my bag at CLT. Found my way here, great beer and awesome food. Highly recommend!

nBv5IyQDGDZTzy6cIQg9Hg.text: Can't even be bothered to update website that they are closed for a private event.... several disgruntled customers all of which double checked hours on website prior to coming... not cool in an arena of new restaurants popping up all the time...clearly service remains an issue for them... save your money and go to a place that will appreciate you and your time.A lack of service mentality will eventually bring down even the most delicious /trendy restaurants. Based on reviews on yelp, word of mouth reviews from peers and my personal experience a service mentality is not a priority.

peFWD0YYfsOVLFJZL6PPlg.text: Excellent and incredibly diverse revolving beer list. Have tried a good chunk of menu items on two visits and really enjoyed the lamb tartar, the ceviche and the burger. Will also echo many other sentiments on the space - very, very well done.

lbYkQsl7jd2rzQk_kRefew.text: Wanted so bad for it to be a 5 star. Standing at outside bar, good selection, friendly quick service, all I could smell was cigarette smoke.

PagMwVaz8bn3v-U0hOHY6A.text: This place is a hidden gem people do not know about it. Best coffee in town !!! Really great place 5 stars !!

KQCRM7kZ9JsZ8LEm0FQljw.text: Make sure you check your accounts after using your cards here. Aside from the charge for our drinks, they also ran the card for $2900. Barely even got an apology for this happening and still paid over $60 for the drinks. Definitely won't be back.

LAAmMmnVKXB6W1abYsHjNA.text: Came here for an early dinner snack on their first official day of business. I was immediately taken back by the decor and overall vibe of the place. Loved all the green plants and pristine bar. Plenty of beers on tap and not the same ol beers you see in every bar around Charlotte. We tried the fries, mushrooms, and potato croquettes. Fries were fine, but nothing special. Mushrooms were oily and not so great. But the croquettes were awesome! The hosts (3) seemed to have no clue what was going on and some of the staff seemed a bit unprepared. However it was their first night so I can't really hold it against them. I will definitely be back for some prime patio sitting and diving more into their menu.

02aOA5V4ZUqR8VeNzY5zkQ.text: This is my favorite place in Charlotte. This is the only brewery in Charlotte where you can get whatever you want. You can get a liquor drink, beer or even coffee. Not one brewery in Charlotte has all of these choices. I think that the decor is so creative and the outdoor area is so cool. I had the burger and those amazing peppers. The peppers are like addicting. Go give this place a try I'm sure you'll go back more than once!

3w6t5G4JGOoV_nTOZ26Mog.text: I want to help you, Suffolk Punch. I realize that your restaurant doesn't officially open until this weekend (by the way amazing restaurant atmosphere), so I understand there should be some leeway in terms of service/food, etc. Unfortunately, real money was spent. I went with my girlfriend and another couple, three of us got burgers and one got the grouper. This was in addition to a few rounds of Hyde beers and shishito peppers. Between my gf and I, the bill was $71 after tip! It's just burgers and beer! There are A LOT of places to get that in Charlotte, and not spend half that, AND you're brewing beer on site. On top of that, the fries were lukewarm, the other couple said the foie gras popcorn "tasted like regular popcorn but for $6", and the burger was so, so, so salty. We're an easy crowd to please, and we all agreed it was a forgettable meal. I hope you can work out the kinks, because the location and atmosphere are great. The food, not so much.

o_ylr4yp2cZ_FmY8rjuZXg.text: The Place looks fantastic inside and out I'll give that 5 stars!!! Most of the people are great that work there, I went there for a few times now and I just moved around the corner. One of the bartender I met I think his name is Mike is an arrogant asshole sorry for my language, he is very disrespectful to everybody that comes up to his bar when he is working and starts acting like a childish kid when he get busy, slamming glasses and ignoring people he doesn't like... He made my last two experiences there awful and I might not come back. Another thing they might need to fix is the chef with all of the hoops in his ear probably needs to learn how to be somewhat quiet and respect his staff some more. He was a little scary and seemed disrespectful. Hope some of the staff gets fixed so I actually might enjoy myself when I come back.

OgkyhBX0H6DooC9WIkzuYw.text: Went there a couple weeks ago on Saturday afternoon. I had been wanting to try it, since hearing and seeing it on social media. Just like someone else said, there's no clear entrance.  Kind of weird. Anyway, we get in there see that there's a coffee bar, then a beer bar around the corner. Plenty of people working, not a single person looked up to say hi, or welcome in, be with you in a sec... ok, so we sit down, after sitting there a bit we realized people don't come to you so we went to the bar to order drinks and food. Again, I came here for the food after reading reviews and seeing pics. We ask for a food menu and the bar tender says, "we don't serve food anymore." And we are like, what? And then he says "well, we don't serve food until 5pm." Uugghh! The whole reason I came was to try the food. I was pretty disappointed. Atmosphere is cute, customer service is pretty bad, and it's lame that food wasn't served until 5pm. I won't be going back.

sZxidJfju46YHfVcubz5dw.text: This spot is a gem!  Another great destination for excellent drinks and food! The bartender was amazing! I enjoyed myself and the ambiance was on point. I will definitely visit Suffolk Punch again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great drink!
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Chicken Hoagie was great!

38JjphPZsc_GCXTqEr4kHQ.text: Huge beer list and amazing ambience...definitely one of the coolest bars/breweries I've been to. The staff was very helpful and attentive. Got the nachos, they were just ok. I haven't tried anything else there but have the feeling you don't go there for the food.

aMTlMTwi_xiwYXvZPfAZpg.text: Fun for a casual night out!   We used the no wait app and were seated prior to our time -- which was great!   I was with all beer drinkers, so they ordered a combination of local beers and beer from Hyde (which is apart of the restaurant). I'm a wino - so I perused the wine list and ordered a sauvignon blanc.    We ordered 2 appetizers, the bratwurst and the bc shrimp. I don't eat sausage so I can't speak to the brat, but the shrimp was well cooked and flavorful    For dinner, I ordered the vegetarian nachos with shrimp. While this is an appetizers, it's absolutely huge and makes a great entree! Recommend that!   I feel like the whole coffee, bar, restaurant concept is really growing here. I can't say I've actually ever had coffee here before though.   The ambience and atmosphere is cool. It's a huge space. We sat on the elevated tables near the back of the restaurant. I like that you can see right through to the brewery. It's really neat and different. The outside area is really cool a- I look forward to spending time there this summer!

cnmvxlbFmfAD9cDClfiNcQ.text: $3 beer special on Thursday and Sunday, and the chicken biscuit for Sunday brunch is great. Can't get enough of the pepper gravy! Service struggles at times, but the shrimp appetizer is worth the wait.

4R2JlaBwUH4fBw6Htr71tQ.text: Always happy at Suffolk punch! They have great cocktails along with an extensive beer list. The staff has always been friendly and attentive. There are 3 options for seating. Inside, outdoors under the tent or outside at Picnic tables with no cover. I've always enjoyed my food and drink here and we often start or end our walks on the rail trail here.

VNq6YlK0qz2B5ZuTzITQvg.text: Giving two stars based off the pretzel dish I ordered. It's a brewery, I feel like the one food item you should get right are the pretzels. I got bread sticks that seemed a day old and the dryness to prove it. So very dry. Do not order them unless you have a salad that you need crutons for.

mHCkyEG9VWcGbxBNZp-aWA.text: My first thought here was "WOW, this place is beautiful!" I went for a friend's birthday party for the first time. We sat outside, and I love all the greenery on the tables.   There's not a ton of parking in the area, so be careful. I had a hard time finding parking on a Thursday when Triple C also has their run club... keep this in mind.   Boodle and I shared an appetizer and also got an entree. Overall our food and drinks were really good, but I felt like it was overpriced for what we had.   The staff was great. We had a birthday cake that they stored and brought out when the time was right. They went above and beyond to make my friend's birthday memorable, and that part was awesome.

5qOjsoE3MXBH8swECVBy-Q.text: Great food, great beer, great atmosphere all for a decent price. (Must try the tiny chicken wings)

yLlwEpsW09eHhe7tqyiztw.text: First visit: Sunday brunch, nice vibe at 10.   Coffee:  drip coffee had a good roasted flavor. Not bitter for strong coffee.  chocolate cinnamon latte: good flavor, nice earthy taste, could be hotter tho.   Food: Suffolk Plate: definitely a good choice. Over medium eggs were done corectly. Old school sausage, real bacon.   Chicken and biscuit: great. Chef Eric would not do scrambled egg white.  Egg yolks make my stomach upset for some reason. I took one for the team. It was good, I recommend it.   Our server was very personable and genuinely interested in his customers.   Will be back to try other items.

Y-bgoG7LOKFvROkJ_25Dfw.text: Located off exit 7 on I-77., there are quite a few breweries you might miss out on if you think downtown charlotte is where you need to go. There's indoor restaurant style seating and bar seating or outdoor tables for some fresh air. The setup is open and modern. A great place to chill if you have down time. Suffolk Punch has great food, excellent coffee , and of course beer. Lenny Boy brewery is a couple blocks away for Kombucha or draft beer, as well. Triple c brewery is next door. Olde mecklenberg brewery is 6 minutes away by car. The light rail stop (new bern stop) is right behind Suffolk. Hit up the next stop or rent a bicycle (charlotte.bcycle.com ) and try Futo Buto if you want some legit ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. The rare selfie. Whiskey and iced coffee
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits. The chorizo and okra were a nice touch. It had a little spicy bite to it that hit the spot.
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee cocktails. This place is both a coffee bar and a brewery

ySoAfQZ1eHjyvsGLSltpqw.text: Per my husband (who is a major foodie), "Best wings I have ever had"! I had the veggie burger.  They got a good  crunchy crust on the patty and it was dressed with creamy goat cheese and homemade bbq sauce.  YUM!

FDuZhNwakYF51oKsDSNFRQ.text: Great food and cocktails!!!  The chicken -n- biscuit is a beautifully done entree, featuring fried chicken, scrambled eggs, and gravy all on a biscuit. I literally thought about my meal for days following my visit. The cocktails are interesting and aesthetically pleasing.

i_gigqMBNDvD1DugFSQreA.text: Really cool new place in Southend. Hyde Brewery provides a great selection of beer on tap, there is a full bar and kitchen and a craft coffee counter as well. I had the Blue Daisy on tap and loved it, definitely recommend.  The decor is beautiful and the space is really calming and inviting. There is a ton of natural light and plants to provide an earthy tone.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

oCIs8JAH-uP9qPn5U5TenA.text: The best cocktails and burgers! The fries are also killer... the shaved Wagyu sandwich is so flavorful and perfectly seasoned. We loved adjusting the burger set ups to be more personalized.

Xe7BxWEX58ILybvweesJ4g.text: A brewery, coffee shop, and restaurant combined in one.....winning! Bonus, it is off of the Rail Trail!  My husband and I stopped in on Valentine's Day to check this place out for the first time. I immediately fell in love with the vibe inside. All the plants just gave it a great atmosphere feel. I also loved the patio area.   We grabbed a seat at the bar. My hubby ordered one of the Hyde Brewing beers and I got a mixed drink (don't remember the name but it had whisky, raspberry puree, and club soda). Both drinks were good. The beer list was fairly extensive and included beers from other local breweries. We ordered the Wagyu beef with dipping sauce as an appetizer. Absolutely delish. I loved the dipping sauce and the meat was so flavorful!  Service was so good! We even got candy for Valentine's day! Absolutely will return!

NOklWgGf3y9vLcCgO1VzoA.text: This place had so much hype leading up to the opening and I have to say it doesn't quite lead up to all the hype.  I got excited when I heard they were going to have a morning coffee window, and then quickly disappointed when it was fancy, extremely over-priced coffees.  Food was good, but they are small plates and having a meal gets expensive there.  I do like their patio, it's a great space and they have done a great job with the space both inside and outside.  Very unique and different.  To me it just does not have the feel of a brewery and they serve more beers from other breweries than their own.

V4cQO2TW9ZCdoiWAiWE-pA.text: Great beer selection and great food menu. There is both indoor and outdoor seating and during the colder months they had a tent up outside which was a great idea. Other outdoor breweries don't typically do that.  What got me to write this review though was their care of their customer. I have a somewhat embarrassing story to explain this. After a long day in the South End with some friends and a family member who was visiting I couldn't find my car. We parked at Suffolk Punch in the morning and to everyone's memory we had not moved the car since, we walked from place to place. It's now 1AM and the Suffolk Punch lot is empty so my first thought was "It was towed or taken." I went inside to Suffolk Punch and the night manager there was more than helpful, he could have just said "no we don't tow sorry now get out" but he came out to the lot with us and waited for the police to show up to try and figure it out. On top of that he actually sent one of his bartenders in their car to search for my car.  End of the story, the bartender found my car some blocks away at another brewery. To all of our memories, I blame the long day, but I thank the Suffolk Punch for all their help in what could've been a really bad end to a good day.

s44MiNp5NZ1o8XyG7dBFXQ.text: The food was good but the service was super slow!!!  We had the fried green tomatoes appetizer and it was yummy!  My daughter had veggie burger and salad and she said it was really good!  If I'm ever back in Charlotte, will definitely visit again!

TspmJSN3VZNpB7SMXdUYnw.text: WONDERFUL ATMOSPHERE! Great location! Great food! Service was outstanding. Wait time was pretty short for the bar. Went on a Saturday and they had live music which was nice. Restaurant was clean and very urban! Very please with taste of food and the options for brunch!

XWdys0eTLG9fpZqvoHTgUQ.text: Visited the Suffolk Punch a lil over a month ago and was impressed.  With so many breweries, chef-driven menus and new venues popping up, it may be hard to stand out, but the Suffolk Punch is no wilting violet.  Fabulous tapas, the coffee bar smelled amazing, just the right amount of beer tastes for all, cool space and very friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Highly recommend for a brunch or lunch.

X9JVOD_9tsetqq01qlAdJA.text: I ordered most of the small plates for dinner instead of a meal because I felt like I would be able to eat a different variety of food. Everything was delicious. What I remember ordering was the short ribs, croquette, pork belly, meatball, raw tuna, and fried green tomatoes. I was very full with the help of a friend. The atmosphere was cozy and the service was good. Possibly make a reservation if you're going to come on a busy night. There's parking all around, so it shouldn't be a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

622s8HRMHtHIMIaAZNCxBA.text: Suffolk Punch is one of my favorite breweries in the Southend. It has got a great outdoor area and so many beers to chose from! They have also have good food, my favorite is their veggie burger-so good! Definitely recommend if you're look for a bite with a good beer! However, I'd suggest taking an Uber or the light rail there because parking is pretty limited, especially Thursday-Sunday.

DvOG3mKTKT-Vn83EIldmjg.text: Finally tried this place for food. We went last Friday evening for drinks, and were not super impressed with the service. There could have been some miscommunication about what we wanted, but at first we had a waiter who was going to take drink orders and then they never came back so we just went to the bar to order.   Anyway, this morning's brunch made up for it. First off, I LOVE the space. I love the plants hanging and along the bar. The fresh green mixed in with the wood and metal is really nice. I'm also a sucker for cool logos and incorporating the designs around the place, which Suffolk Punch/Hyde does really well. We got there at noon and had no wait getting a table. Two of us opted for the omelet and one got the French toast (which looked amazing). Omelet was also yummy! The side was fingerling potatoes, which are actually just French fries but they were pretty good as well. I got a side of bacon- DELICIOUS. I will say the coffee was $3 and then there was an additional charge for another cup. They brewed it fresh, but kind of expected a coffee refill to be free.   Otherwise, service was great and the food was also really good. We will definitely be back to try other stuff on the menu, including the cocktails!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZJLsKzrCmiOVuG2HLpjsQg.text: Food and service were great here. Really cool vibe inside. Love the decor. Really sets the tone for the experience here.   Had a flight of beer. They have a large variety of their own brews. The flight can only be done with their brand and not the other beer they have on tap.

LIKIW5Yl0xraRp-FawyLtQ.text: I love the brewery, but the food service isn't great. We went on a Sunday and were seated within 20 mins.... but after ordering, we waited for over an hour and still didn't have our food. We ended up having to change our order to go since we had our baby with us and he was losing patience. Only to find out when we got home they forgot to include one of our meals.   On the plus side --- the food is delicious and the manager was quick to apologize and offer a refund when I called.    Not sure I would go back to the restaurant, but I still recommend if you're looking for a brewery to just hang out!

038gVA5OwAHUJ6ZBF0Zk9g.text: I heard so many great things about this place for brunch, sadly, I was disappointed. The chicken in the chicken biscuit was good, minus the fact that the biscuit tasted old and a little hard... almost like it was an old batch. The egg sandwich had no flavor and could be made better at home. I will say, the best part of the meal was the roasted potatoes. Other than that, I don't think I'll be back for brunch here.

tmvvQm4Y6qH4al2QdcqJ0w.text: The outdoor patio is nice for overflow or when it is raining. But if you come here for brunch, get the egg biscuit. You will regret it if you don't. Also for a coffee cocktail go for Whiskey Business. You'll thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

LWFtGIsCcm_69Y2_9yDtVQ.text: Was excited to try this out. Location looks really cool. Food menu looked intriguing.   Once we finally had a seat, the waitress kept stopping by saying she would be there shortly. I'm being generous by saying it was probably 15min later that she came by with water.   Later she came for orders. We got things very intermittently.   About 19 minutes after ordering our app came. The biscuits and gravy appetizer were probably the worst biscuits and gravy I've ever had. Since we were sharing I was able to look past this because I only had a small piece.   30 min later our drinks came. After asking numerous times for them.   Another 30 min later our food came. I ordered the hash. I was expecting seasonal veggies as the menu said but it was 95% potatoes. I had a few bites of quartered Brussels and maybe a slice or two of carrots. And by slice. I mean a literal slice of carrot. If you want veggies don't order this. To make it worse, my over easy eggs, were overly cooked. As far from over easy as you can get. You might as well call it a hard boiled egg in over easy display. So extremely disappointing.   I don't leave bad reviews. But I wish I had a warning about this place before going. So many good options in Charlotte and I hate I missed out with this stop before heading back home to Michigan. Next time. Definitely won't be a stop here.   I told our waitress but of course she didn't really seem to care as she was obviously exhausted from The day and only could concern herself with clearing our dishes before the 4pm Crowd came.

glSQGBBji3k5MyRRYEHa1w.text: Excellent service,  ambiance, and food! We came here on a whim for brunch on a Saturday afternoon. It was myself,my mother, sister, and my 11 month old daughter. We sat outside as the weather was perfect. I love that you can seat yourself, order your food (and drinks) at the bar, and then they bring everything to you. The vibe is very laid back! There are high chairs for babies which I loved. The outdoor seating is also pet friendly. I noticed they even put out bowls of water for dogs which I thought was sweet.  The bartender made EXCELLENT drinks. I left having 2 drinks and felt NICE (lol) after leaving. We ordered a carafe of mimosa and then I had a cucumber mule which was AWESOME! For breakfast we had shrimp and grits, and also the suffolk breakfast  (eggs, bacon, sausage, and grits (my mom got hers with potatoes).  We received our food quickly and the servers were kind.  I loved that my daughter could people watch and walk around the outdoor area freely without feeling like we were bothering anyone or in the way. She loved looking at the dogs and walking around the picnic tables.    After brunch we walked alongside the light rail strip for a bit and then headed back to our car.  It was a great afternoon. We will definitely be back as I want to see what Hyde Brewery has to offer!

oC44Tm0f_H370k93NgYtcQ.text: I had such a wonderful expedience here today! Our wait staff was polite, personable and very helpful. I snagged their yummy grilled chicken sandwich which had queso, pickled onions and two grilled chicken breasts. To say it was yummy would be an understatement! It was delicious! I will be back for sure! The outdoor seating was delightful, I loved that they had awnings over the tables that ACTUALLY blocked the sun effectively. The inside of this adorable restaurant, bar, coffeehouse hybrid had modern, quaint AND hipster vibes which made for awesome decor. I had a great time and will totally be back!   Food 10/10 Atmosphere 10/10 Staff 10/10 Decor 10/10!

mY_nRwI5VSEwSLfX8oUZkg.text: Terrible salty food and dry dessert. Service is excellent tho. Great place to have a few drinks not so much the food. It's a nightmare to find parking on the weekends.

0hhseDzVCWKRJFgOdUE4Ug.text: Good vibe and place for drinks.  Don't come here for the food, but rather the drinks and atmosphere.  Will absolutely be coming back!

32PRjOtxFwkSVVVqPJNokw.text: Tried their Oat Milk Latte for the first time and it was soooo delicious that I went back for another two days later. Great service and super cute vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States

RfNrheOQuBQY3_cLXRhgLg.text: Suffolk Punch is a great option in South End and not too far from the light rail. Parking can be challenging as there are no lots and it's all on-street parking. We parked near a friends home and walked over so we had no issues.   The vibe is relaxed and trendy with a slight industrial feel. We had a fairly large party but they were able to seat us right away. Their largest table was taken, but they were able to squeeze all nine of us in a to a six-person table. We appreciated not having to wait.  Water was already set out on the table. And drink orders were put in quickly. They have an extensive beer menu. That night it was only $3 for any Charlotte beers on the menu. There are cocktails, but they don't have a full bar. From what my coworkers said, the cocktails were very good. And there's a few wines on the menu as well. It's definitely a great place to grab a drink.   The menu has both small plates and meals. So you can decide if you want something small or a meal for yourself. I ordered the F.L.T. sandwich with a salad. The F.L.T. was a fried green tomato, bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwich on toasted wheat bread with a herbed mayo. I loved this sandwich.  It didn't feel overly greasy, and the fried green tomatoes can be a dish on their own. They were crisp and flavorful.  I wish there was a little more mayo on the sandwich, but it was still satisfying. The side salad was so fresh with green lettuce, raddichio, carrot and red pepper. Normally I order dressing on the side, but they had a very light vinegrette mixed in and was still delicious.    I'd love to come back for drinks and small plates. I regret not getting the charcuterie plate and would love to go back for that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. F.L.T. for the win!

U49byx97quCe0Q4YAzLyjA.text: Separate review from Hyde Brewing - but go check them out too! Great beer!  I've eaten at Suffolk Punch twice, and have been impressed by two dishes: the potato croquettes and the veggie burger. The Goose had never had a croquette before (I lived in Spain for 6 months so those things are my kryptonite). The croquettes at Suffolk Punch lived up to the dish's expectations! Creamy and perfectly crisp on the outside. Nom.  The veggie burger gets a shout out because it puts a different spin on a pretty standard dish. The patty is quinoa/black bean, which is pretty normal, but they jazzed it up with a tangy BBQ sauce and goat cheese. It was surprising and delicious! The hand cut fries did pretty well too :)

Pf85g_-GdzR4mJ633w5Sqg.text: The Southend/Dilworth area of town needs more places like The Suffolk Punch.  It's a huge space that has a little bit of everything for everyone.  Good Food-check.  Good Drinks-check.  Good Atmosphere-check.  When you first walk in, it's a little confusing.  I'm going to The Suffolk Punch, but I think I might be at Hyde Brewery?  I walked in the door and after finally seeing a sign to go to the back of the restaurant, I found the hostess stand.  We put our name in on the No Wait app, so we only ended up waiting for about 15 minutes (vs. the quoted 30-45 min).  As I waited, I looked around at the beautiful plants hanging from the ceiling, the games that were playing on the TVs throughout the inside and the large outdoor space with patio tables.  I thought to myself, this would be a great place to come with a group to watch football!  They can certainly accommodate large groups.  We stopped at the bar to grab a drink first.  Might as well!  Their cocktails were refreshing and their beer list was extensive.  The bar was also really long and they have a ton of taps, so the bartender struggle a bit with remembering drinks as he was running back and forth.  I also noticed that they have a little coffee bar off to the side.  It's pretty hidden, but I wouldn't think to come here in the morning for my caffeine fix.  Once we were seated, we went through the menu.  Starters were the Heirloom Tomatoes (came recommended by the waitress), Summer Squash and Potato Croquettes.  Everything was very good and super fresh!  I loved the Potato Croquettes because, I mean, who doesn't love fried potato balls in a yummy tomato sauce?!  For entrees, we had the fish and the roasted chicken (which was slightly overcooked, but still tasty).  Overall, great new spot!  Food and atmosphere are lively.  Perfect place for a group of people to meet for drinks.  Service was slow all around, so plan to be patient.  Their menu is very inventive, so I'll be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted squash, heirloom tomatoes, and potato croquettes
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Mildenhall Treasure...good refreshing summer drink
Photo of The Suffolk Punch - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktail and wine menu

WqUH1b6LUn0m9wJQbpldEw.text: Short version: Go for the beer, service and ambience. The food left much to be desired and there is no coffee or tea past 4pm on weekdays and 5pm Friday-Sunday.   Long version: This place had been on my list for months and finally the hubs and I got to check it out. There is a small gravel parking lot on the right side of the building and some random street parking on the block.    On the Saturday night that we went, they had guys at the door carding patrons before entering. Once we walked past the bathrooms and hallway that passes the brewery, we got to the hostess and they seated us right away. Our waitress came over promptly with a glass pitcher of water and glasses. I love when restaurants do this because my hubby goes through a lot of water so it's nice to just serve yourself a glass. I saw tea and coffee on the menu with a note that said the full menu was not available after 4pm on weekdays and 5pm on weekends but what they actually mean is that none of the options are available...zero...no regular American coffee, no tea of any kind. This was unfortunate for me because I really wanted something warm and part of the reason we went there was to try their coffee.   I ordered an unsweet tea with no ice. My hubs ordered a beer. We also ordered from the small plates: Pork Belly, Charred Wings and Crab Croquettes. My tea came with a paper straw (yay for them doing good for the environment) but it tasted mildly fermented and had thin layer of foam/head on top that I was not a fan of.     The best food item we had was the charred wings. Those guys were really tasty and well done. Not sure where they get the wings from because they are tiny but meaty and tasted very good. The pork belly left much to be desired, it was bland and the rice cake it was served with was also very bland. The Crab croquettes were cooked really nicely, and definitely had plenty of crab, but also left a lot to be desired. The elote with cheese that came with the crab was also pretty tasteless.     It was so disappointing. Honestly, the service was great, the food looked very nicely presented but the flavors just weren't there. The place seemed very nice to just hang out and drink beer. The bathrooms were clean and even the guys carding at the door were super friendly but if it's food you are after; I cannot recommend.    Who knows? Maybe it was an off night?

OgD3bc0xXFwYBZ5YC2NC2Q.text: I had heard about this place opening up and knew it was across from CCC Brewing, but had not had a chance to experience it myself until my wife and I stopped in the other night. First off, the space is incredible. Very open, lots of natural wood, and a huge patio. From the front you would not have guessed the size of this place. In addition, I like the idea of combining a brewery, coffee bar, and restaurant all in one - and right off the rail trail!   Full disclaimer before we go further, I only had a few beers here and an appetizer - not a full dinner. That being said, I tried 2 of Hyde's beers (FYI Hyde brewing is part of the Suffolk Punch, that confused me for a while) and enjoyed both while my wife had a mixed drink. We also ordered a Wagyu beef appetizer with dipping sauce and found it to be excellent. I'll be excited to come back once the weather warms up a bit and sit on the patio to try more of their menu and beer selection.

lp9z9Y4luM0g-ggtQ5Rp3A.text: Very disappointing experience. The waitress was not very good. She wasn't attentive. I went with two others to eat dinner and being a type 1 diabetic I avoid carbs as much as possible. The only thing remotely close for me to eat was a steak. The steak came with truffled potatoes. I don't eat potato's because it messes with my blood sugar. I asked to substitute the potatoes for a salad. We waited ten minutes to order to give the waitress time to inquire whether it is possible to make the substitution, we watched her. She never went to the back to ask the chef or manager. By the time we order, I asked if she could accommodate, she quickly said, No! Ok, I'll order nothing!  I understand making substitutions is not ideal but, make the effort. If it cost more money ok, give me the option. The waitress was the problem here, unless it is the  restaurants decision to not allow substitutions.

C7h54RYwmqxPBzZDrXP8nw.text: This is an interesting place to visit. It reminds of one of thoses spaces, while very nice, that is having an identity crisis. I say that because they are a brewery that has an extensive menu with beer and coffee. While that may be okay for some, I'd much prefer they advertise as a restaurant. I had no idea they had that much.   Overall the interior is beautiful, green and spacious. The bar is good but they also have coffee. Although good, a few of their items are definitely overpriced considering it is a brewery. The staff was attentive but on the first visit my Fiancee's burger wasn't done (twice) and we ordered food that they actually didn't have that night. There seemed to be a bit of poor communication amongst the kitchen and FOH staff.   I'll definitely go back but most likely just for drinks.

qaQQiUe49O-coNLm-jdMwA.text: Great location! My friend I was visiting in Charlotte recommended this place while I was in town. I went around brunch hour so I started with a coffee then went to beer. Coffee was great but a little pricey. Beer was good as well! I say at the bar and some guy named Sean to my order and kept me entertained before I left out of town. So go there order a beer and ask for Sean! Tall guy, you can't miss him.

9fH67gh5wU07_12bnZXUYA.text: The Suffolk Punch had some great choices that aren't common in restaurants. The drinks are strong and reasonably priced. I'd go back to sit on the patio and to try something new!

cXhWitCC1vH7IuWT7uAgPA.text: Great atmosphere & service.  Small plates (fried pickles and grilled peppers) were very good.  The Suffolk Burger was mediocre... (why I have them a 4 instead of 5) Overall, we enjoyed and will be back...

OAjE8GpKLETNRji0YDZs8A.text: Meh, overpriced and average. Really neat vibe, multiple breweries featured, nice outdoor area. Waited over 2 hours to be seated--followed by a 20 minute wait to be greeted by a server.

g7q3PbtDVBMLmkmwDHm2Ug.text: I really want to like this place since it is a few blocks from my house. Food is very solid but nothing special for the price. The space is just great. Simply gorgeous. Mixed drinks are insanely overpriced. I generally never get sticker-shock when I get the tab, but when I opened the bill my jaw dropped. This is the type of price I would expect from a rooftop bar like Merchant & Trade but not from this place. This isn't Punch Room... come on. The staff seems fine but they have only one speed... slow. They are nice enough but again, very, painfully slooooow and appear to be lacking in service industry experience. When it is busy, as it usually is, this makes for a long frustrating wait. Bartender didn't know what a pilsner was. I'll be back because of the location but I doubt I'll ever stay for more than a drink or two.

SMg0K4rE5BT70WYCpWHzKA.text: This was a pretty cool spot that I'll definitely return to.  The atmosphere inside is nice and warming, although finding a seat can be a challenge. During my visit, we were able to get seats at the bar after hanging around for 10 minutes. The drink  menu is fairly extensive, and the staff seem more than willing to give you recommendations and small samples to find something you'd like. As i didn't want beer that evening, the bald, bearded bartender suggested a cocktail that he was able to whip up which was very good. He and the rest of the staff were very friendly and welcoming despite being a bit busy.  I I'll definitely need to return to try some of their Hyde beers as they continue to roll them out. Overall, it seems like a great venue in South End and a much better option for low-key drinks over the frat wasteland known as Sycamore.

ZzTyJeJzedick2NMgutO5Q.text: I came here the other night as I had been hearing really good things about Suffolk. To start, the decor and ambiance is incredible. Its very open and a great place to hang. The outdoor patio is even more incredible and has plenty of room so it never really feels crowded. I started with one of their beers think it was the Donington - one of Hyde's own brews. Really enjoyed it. Then I checked out their cocktail list - even MORE killer! I had come to try the beers but ended up falling in love with the inventive craft cocktails they had. I would recommend the Lime in the Coconut or the Hyde Daisy. Whether you are a cocktailer or a beer drinker - you cant go wrong with the beverages here. We also got a few bites to eat - peppers, potato croquettes and the smoked heirloom tomatoes. All of which were stellar. Lastly, but what I consider to be most important was the service. Regardless of how good the drinks, ambiance or food is, if the service sucks, it can ruin a place. However, Hyde/Suffolk comes out on top in this department. When I first arrived, the bartender working - (Mike? i think was his name?) helped me find a beer he thought I would like and then introduced me to that tantalizing cocktail menu! Not only was he helpful and kind but he was very attentive even with the busy night he had been having - he's also easy on the eyes ;) I also met another bartender who said she had recently started with Suffolk but has worked in the industry for quite some time - just by watching her work and seeing her interacting with customers and the bar staff, you can tell that she knows what shes doing. She was very professional and on top of her game. Also was another incredibly nice person (Rachel? or Reagan?). Both of them were a class act & really worked hard to make sure everyone and everything was taken care of. No question, I will be back and am adding Hyde/Suffolk to my regular spot rotation :) Looking forward to enjoying many more nights here! Definitely a place to check out!

o6cpElhRogfAF79rOIsiig.text: I had an amazing time with my parents, my best friend and boy. we ordered the  ROASTED SUMMER SQUASH and the grilled bacon as starters and it was great!!! My mom and I shared the mussels and steak and it was all perfectly cooked and tasted even better. We all loved the interior decor. It does get a little crowed as the night goes on but other then that it is a great place to sit and have a meal with family and friends . RJ the chef is an amazing cook!!!!

PYHvjgZMX1QguqG7ZGB_NQ.text: Service was terrible. A manager walked by and for some reason lingered but said nothing to us. We never got the second drink we ordered. I get that they're new but my God they need to get it together.

q53obe99lAY4O0cu5A2Utg.text: Pretty good.   We went there for brunch and although the menu was short there were plenty of good options.  The omelette I ordered was one of the best I've ever had.

loIYbJvDLiDAom6i71_VOA.text: Went to try out the new spot last Saturday. Very cool place. Hung outside for awhile, while waiting for a table to eat inside. Bartenders outside sucked and were sweating profusely. They had a water container that was empty 99.9% of the time and they couldn't provide water any other way which was ridiculous on a 95 degree day. When we finally got sat by the 8 year old hostess who has never worked a day in service industry in her life, the service was embarrassingly bad. Food was good but way over priced. The best service we got was from the food runner! Most of the beers they claimed to have were all sold out. Clearly new places have bumps in the road while opening but I doubt I'll be back despite the cool atmosphere.

r9xTX1IXKh9OQIZxFLoxdw.text: It's hard for me to understand how many reviewers for this brew pub could give it a good  rating. There was not one acceptable thing I could say about our experience. From the start with sloppy bartenders; actually had to ask for napkins to clean up their mess, untrained wait staff,  an inexperienced and bit officious hostess, 3 guys hanging by the hostess stand doing nothing and looking like the 3 stooges.  7  diners ordered 5 appetizers and 7 meals. Meats were dry and over cooked, fried green tomato were to thick, too green and poorly fried, French fries too done in bad oil.  The chef and expediter need to look at what is coming out of their kitchen.  It was an awful experience.  Not planning on a second visit.  Too many other good proven choices.

ytJhrynfS1Zm2icD3sgj7A.text: This place is Suffolk-ing good. Lost one star because the beet salad needed more cheese/pistachios and the fried green tomatoes were a bit too firm. Also Tyler V was attentive and helpful, 5 stars for him!

STkCS-Xko1CLA0tLhpJl_g.text: We sat at the bar and had food and drinks. The food was great and the service even better. The bartender, John, was fantastic! We had an Old Fashioned, deviled eggs, and the beet salad all of which were delicious! Looking forward to returning!

9Aw7D6vy1R_nYzU1lQebtA.text: The boyfriend and I came here on a date. Beautiful setting and the service was good. Food were tasteful and varieties on drinks. Busy night but somehow we felt like the limelight of the night. :)

6Ew612vCpa2cRVUShYmgug.text: Had our first experience at The Suffolk Punch.  I really only have one tip and one complaint for anyone who is visiting. Parking is TERRIBLE. I get that comes with the location, but it was difficult to find a spot on a weekday at 6:00. I really wish they would offer flights - there are so many great beers! (take note, in order to get samples you have to go to the bar, your server will not bring it to your table) Now on to all the great things - what an awesome atmosphere. Good food options and again, nice beer selection. The croquettes were very good and the burger was amazing and flavorful. The creole shrimp didn't give the "kick" I would have hoped for, it was almost watered down, so I would probably pass on that in the future.  The burger, shrimp, and croquettes were perfect split between 2 people. Great crowd, and the service was OK. Overall, we will be back for sure. Glad to have found this spot!

7NyJCxhVM1rn4ea1APegCQ.text: Giving 4 stars because I went on their 3rd night open so giving them a pass on some stuff related to just getting started. The atmosphere is the best part which is meaningful in charlotte where a lot of new places are built in a spec space with minimal upfit. The food was OK. Mussels and shitshito pepper were a 8/10. Burger was over salted so a 5/10 relative to all the good burgers in town. We got a blue gin cocktail that was sent back. They did take off the bill and replaced with a nice rose at no charge. Service was good not great but most hiccups just new place kinks expected with large crowds. Staff was high quality probably just a little overwhelmed. Will go back in a few weeks with hope the food and drink are a bit better. At worst it's a good place to hang and drink the beer and wine.

oRn_LGaO31ZxeoGX0lfa6A.text: Service was awful at the bar. We wanted to order dinner, but by the time we had got our drinks (just one round) and a small app, we where looking at 50 minutes. After 20 minutes of being done with the apps and drink a bartender comes up and asks "you good".. got the check ($30 for 2 drinks and an app.. cmon guys you're not that good) and left. Didn't even have a single one of your own beers on draft. I understand this is a soft opening, but cmon..

klaxU7OM8r72DzurJzYzoQ.text: Wonderful food and excellent waiter, unprofessional manager who tried to discourage our waiter from checking we were ok

SvS8Ggo9nHazpcdDBQkEXA.text: Came the other night for drinks after work. Loved this place. I shared small plates with a friend and all the food was amazing. Trust me...get the peppers. Our bartender was Dexter. He was awesome and knew exactly which cocktails to recommend. The outside seating area is large, great for happy hours. I will definitely be coming back to this place.
